reviews.text: Hands down the worse customer service experience I have ever had, lack of humanity and care. I used my digital card to make a booking online, not knowing i needed to present a physical card in branch,... See more

Hands down the worse customer service experience I have ever had, lack of humanity and care. I used my digital card to make a booking online, not knowing i needed to present a physical card in branch, I’ve been told I can’t get a refund as the package is non refundable, it was a honest mistake and should be looked at as such. Complete scam. Avoid Europcar if you want better customer care please go elsewhere!
Totally rubbish telling you no delivery till tomorrow or you can collect. Totally unacceptable behaviour to a disabled person

I had a great rental experience with Europcar last week and it was all because of Tami at the Heathrow pick up desk on the N Perimeter Rd at Heathrow. Efficient, polite and helpful all through the pick up process he's a credit to the company. The car was clean, in great condition and drop off was super efficient a couple of days later. Very good experience. Thank you!

Europcar took 3 payments out of wife's bank account twice for identical sums of money. She is still waiting for a refund and being fed a load of lies from Europcar even with them having accepted liability for the error and told her that the money was released 2 weeks ago. Its now a month since it happened. On top of this, the car has been returned and their pre authorisations have not been released and the deposit has not been returned.
Their continued moving of timelines and this behavior has to be illegal as I do not understand how they can simply take money out of a bank account when the customer has not authorised it. Tesco can't do that with shopping.

The booking.com website led me to Keddy by Europcar at Valencia airport in July with the promise of "no queues" but I had to wait more than 30 minutes to collect on arrival. I reserved a "T-Roc or similar" and tried to pre-empt me not getting "or similar" by contacting Europcar (Madrid) in advance. They responded with a "we cannot promise anything" and indeed when I arrived was given a Hyundai Tucson covered in scratches with a flogged engine 65k on the clock. Europcar then pre-authorised 800 Euros on my credit card in case of collision even though I had paid an extra 70 pounds to booking.com for full additional insurance (excess insurance). I hated the Hyundai Tucson. The safety features were infuriating with the parking brake auto-hold not having a light on the console and the locked patrol cap. The staff were very polite at Europcar Valencia airport but the experience was a let-down. One week after returning the car I noticed a further charge from Europcar on my credit card. When I contacted them they said it was an "environmental contribution" charged to me in error when it should have been charged to the intermediary (i.e. booking.com). Long story short I would avoid using either Europcar or booking.com for a car rental in the future.
Scam, not only did they take additional money for insurance, they kept my deposit saying I scratched the car.

Avoid

I rented a car for a month in June 2025. The collection was smooth although, while the car had been washed, it had not been wiped dry and so was covered with water marks. I inspected the car reasonably thoroughly and could not see any damage.

On returning the car the member of staff immediately identified what she claimed was damage but to my mind was a mark on the rear bumper that was hardly visible and not possible to see without wiping away the water marks. Nevertheless, the staff member required me to sign the Statement of Return acknowledging the damage. She told me that is it was the only way I would get my deposit back and also implied that the damage would be assessed by an expert and would probably not be an issue. As I was in a hurry to catch my flight I signed document.

Unbelievable experience with this awful company and the partner companies I have had to deal with.
Booked a Citroen C3 fuel car for 12 days in Tolouse in late July. (almost £300 total) . I used the GOTrentalcars website to book the car from Europcar.

My Ryanair flight was late so I got to the Europcar at 12.30am. They did not have the Citroen C3. They insisted I had booked an electric car of the lowest category. ( Major Red Flag) I insisted I hadn't because I deliberately excluded electric cars when booking. The electric car they wanted to give me could only drive for 1 hour before needing charging. I would never have willingly booked this.

They only had 1 fuel car to offer me but it was going to cost an extra £60 PER DAY!!! I was absolutely stuck, I had a young child with me and it was 1am on a saturday night, I had to drive for 1.5 hours to get to our accomodation. I was forced to get the fuel car at £60 extra per day but they said I could try and explain the next day and change it. All day Sunday and Monday was ruined because I was trying to sort out the situation on the phone and eventually just had to go back to return the car and try to get refunded for the 10 days. But they still have not refunded me. ( RED FLAG - staff directly lied to me)
However the Europcar staff at Toulouse airport were completely UNHELPFUL and RUDE. RED FLAG. I had an argument with them in the Toulouse airport. I parked the car near their returns office and went away for an hour.

When I came back to return the car, they said there was a dimple on the rear door. RED FLAG! I KNOW that I hadn't ever touched this door or seen the dimple when I checked the car over. I think they did it out of malice for my complaining. I asked to check cctv but there wasnt any. They forced me to sign a thing saying I had created the dimple. I definitely did not. It is so small that I took a close-up photo and you still can't see it. They have taken £800 out of my bank account. They have not even refunded me 10 days' worth of £ that I had paid.

Every staff member that I spoke to from GOTrental cars and Europcar says I signed the contract in the first place for the car. I keep saying I was FORCED to sign it because I was stuck in the middle of the night with a child and they did not have the car I had booked. I am being totally GASLIT by these theiving, tricking, fraudulent blatant liars, and they now owe me £1200 plus 2 days of my holiday plus petrol and toll money to return the wrong car.

THEY WILL NOT GET AWAY WITH THIS.

After using this company for car rentals quite often over a few years, I thought I'd grown to trust them as one of the better car rental companies that weren't out to scam you at every possible opportunity.

Unfortunately, I was proven wrong when I was handed a cleaning fee for having some dirt, from a shoe, in the footwell of the car. This was deemed excessive and upon querying the matter, I was told this would require 'expert third party cleaners ' and 'the cleaning of a interior specialist'.

Direct quotes, yet evidence of this was never produced and I was ignored for over a month before receiving a dismissive email saying they will not be replying any more.

If only photos were allowed on this platform to show how little dirt was apparently deemed to be excessive. I have since moved to using other car rental companies, as this lack of customer service for a long-standing customer, or anyone, is just not good enough.

I will be reporting them to the British Vehicle Rental and Leasing Association for breaching their code of conduct in their handling of this matter.

I booked a hire car and paid for it using my Monzo card, got a train to Gatwick Airport and brough this card with me like the booking confirmation said to. I hired another vehicle with Europcar earlier this year and had no problems paying the deposit using this card.

Got to the branch to be told by staff that they don't accept Monzo so I couldn't hire the car. Nobody could explain why this was their policy, only that they had to cancel the booking.

I offered to make a full payment for the deposit amount which could be refunded when I returned the car, but the staff weren't having it either. I spoke to the branch manager, who could only tell me that they didn't accept Monzo and I'd have to cancel my booking.

This policy seems to be based on the understanding that Monzo cards aren't "real debit cards", which doesn't seem to be true.

In the end, I had to ask my friend to travel to the branch with another card, and Europcar refuse to cover the costs of this even though (1) they literally told me to bring the card I used to pay for the booking and (2) their terms say they accept debit cards.

Europcar's customer service have just ignored my attempts to get them to refund me for these costs, or to at least explain their policy. Useless.

If anyone from Europcar reads this, my case number is 23955880.

I’m very disappointed with this group
I got a lawyers letter through this morning which I have been asked to pay for damage to the car I hired from the 29/05/2025 to the 02/06/2025.i never got anything back from them regarding this and as far I knew everything was ok.
I since tried to call the lawyers and was on the phone for 1.5 hours to get someone. I gave up on that and called the head office of Europcar to discuss the matter. The woman name was lynne who insisted that they had sent a email for recovery of damage. I then checked my junk mail and found 2 emails from Europcar. One was the invoice from them on the 04/06/2025 saying the car was ok and the deposit would be returned
Which it was by Europcar.

Then on the the 23/06/2025 I have another email regarding the damage to the car ( which was a flat tyre and I picture of the tyre with the nail in it.
3 weeks after the so called nail was in the tyre they contact me to inform me that I must of done it and they were going to charge me for the time it was off the road a new tyre and admin fees of 251.64. Something I did not know about til now.
I know I checked the car out and it did not have a puncture as I checked all aspects at of it with a friend who assisted me in the process. At no point was the car damaged or anything wrong with it.
How can this company say the car was ok and issue an invoice on the 4th June 2025 and then 3 weeks later decide that the car had a puncture and decide to send me a bill.
They must of done this when driving the car round the car park or someone else who hired it and the only person they could blame was the last person who drove it. This is wrong on all levels and I will contest it as it looks like they are blaming anyone they can. Absolute disgrace from Europcar and as a company I used to use regularly I won’t be using again and I will tell anyone who is using this company do not use them as they are not true to there words of being a good company who cares about the drivers.
I received a request for payment for damage present when I RECEIVED the vehicle. Europcar are continuing to pursue the payment. I have photographic evidence with date stamps on the photographs.

Booking No. 1192827246 – Terrible Experience

If I could rate this company 0 stars, I would. Europcar is a scam company that happily takes money from customers but doesn’t provide the car you booked. They confirmed my reservation and took my payment without doing the necessary checks. I travelled all the way to London City Airport, only to be told I couldn’t collect the car.

This company wastes people’s time and money, and it feels like they take bookings just to hold customers’ money for their own interest. Disgraceful service, no accountability, and a complete scam. Avoid Europcar at all costs.

I receive a hire car after an accident. It was a Volvo XC60. I get the car, drive to the supermarket, comeback and the car is dead. Bearing in mind I am due to go on a family holiday in a couple of hours.
I can’t get in touch with Birmingham Newtown branch. I manually manage to open the key fob and the limp the car to the branch who swap it over.
So I have had to return an unsafe car. When it comes to pick up the car after chasing me despite me telling them that it will be returned when my repairs are done they can’t be bothered to pick up the car and I have to wait again for them to pick them up.
I return the car will a full tank and the engineer marks
The paper work to reflect that. I then get just under £20 taken out of my account being told the tank wasn’t full.
I have sent them their own paperwork and have asked for a refund. I spoke to monosyllabic customer service agent who didn’t initially understand the issue. The whole experience has been shocking. Truly truly awful experience. I am now chasing my refund as a point of princible.

Crooks!
They told me at the rental desk that I could bring the fuel tank back at any level and they would fill it up at cost price for no extra charge.
2 days after I had returned the car with 7/8 full tank, they charged me £67!!
No responses to emails sent to complain, and unable to do anything on the phone.
DO NOT USE EUROPCAR

Daylight Robbery. Had to cancel my booking from Inverness Airport branch as my flight was cancelled . I foolishly hadn't checked every square millimetre of the website to find the 'refundable booking' button when I made the reservation so got charged the full value of the booking (£748.00) which included all the insurance waivers, extra driver even though clearly never used, surprised they didn't charge me for some fuel as well! In the end, we had to hire a car in Huntingdon and drive up to Scotland, and as Europcar had said they would refund me the full amount and didn't have a branch in Huntingdon, we used Enterprise - brilliant service, better car and cost £50 less anyway despite being a one-way hire with unlimited mileage. Will never use Europcar, ever.

Scammers, extremely shady outfit.

I picked up my car in Johannesburg and they tried to give me a car without a damage report, telling me “it will be fine”.

Upon checking the car it had clearly been in some form of accident. It took an hour of refusing to take the car without damage report for them to finally say they would bring me a new car at my address later, but that I should take this one for now (I assume they then would have said the car was damaged by in the time between me taking it and them brining the new one).

Travelling with a newborn, this was stressful and they eventually brought me a new car with a damage report and assured me that I had the maximum insurance. Unfortunately this was not the case as I was hit by a driver running a red light and Europcar took £2000 from me.

Be careful, these guys are extremely shady.
I’m renting with them regular for few months and today I can’t rented because my credit score filed,rubbish company and very expensive I didn’t recommend …!

Worst rental company in world
We book a car and hotel every thing
And when we went to collect the car they said we don’t have any car
We only have 8 car that booked for others
And even they didn’t offer any replacement car in other branch’s
When called cuz service they said if you pay £40 extra we can book you a car in another branch

Classic case of should have read this before we booked.
Complete shambles from start to finish.
Tried to add a booster seatto our booking, which wasn't possible. Tried to reach customer service which was impossible.
When we collected the car, they wanted 100€ for a booster seat. Even in Switzerland it costs about 15€ to buy one (which we did!).
They then told us we needed a Vignette to drive in Switzerland (another 40 CHF). When we tried to buy one online it transpired the car already had one (of course it did, they are valid for a year). The police confirmed when we asked.
Why oh why would you make your customers' lives more difficult?
Terrible terrible service, and I will not use them ever again.

Truly awful service for disabled customers – avoid if you can

If you are disabled and rely on Motability, avoid Europa Car Belfast at all costs. Unfortunately, they have the contract with Motability for hire cars if your vehicle breaks down – but that “service” is virtually non-existent.

They rarely answer the phone, and when they finally do, they lie. I was told a car would be ready for me in 2 days. That never happened. A week later, I still have no car, no update, and no way of knowing when (or if) I’ll get one.

I am disabled and live in a remote area with no access to shops or medical appointments without a vehicle. This delay has left me completely stranded and put my health at risk. The lack of care or urgency for a disabled customer’s needs is absolutely shocking.

Europa Car Belfast have shown themselves to be unreliable, dishonest, and completely unsympathetic to the needs of vulnerable people. If you have any other option, take it – because you cannot count on them.

Hired a car from the Gloucestershire branch, when asked if I needed to know anything about driving in the UK all I was told you drive on the same side of the road as in Australia. I returned the vehicle some 25 hours before the due date and time and never received a refund. Upon my return to Australia I received an email and infringement notice to say I drove in the coach lane at Manchester Airport for 34 seconds. I paid this fine and also received a further invoice of 45 UK pound for Europcar for passing on the original fine. When I questioned this I received an email to say my query was being investigated and I would be notified soon. I did not received a refund for the early return of the car and I advised Europecar UK to use that money to cover the cost of typing my email address to cover the costs of passing on the infringement fine. Europcar UK charged my credit card without my knowledge for the said 45 UK pound. To use my credit card without my authorization is criminal and I believe this to be corporate fraud. I am still await the 'outcome' of Europcar UK investigation. Would NOT recommend Europcar UK to any future hirers.

Hired a car from Toulouse Airport. On returning the vehicle they refused to examine the car. They are now saying that there is a 2 - 5cm light scuff.
Cost to repair - 550E
Loss of Use - 4 days - 138E Yes 4 days to repair a 2 - 5 cm light scuff
Admin - 72E
Money grubbing racket, I believe because I wouldn't take out their excess cover - I have third party cover.
I will never use them again

I am giving this Company a 1 star review, because I cannot give them any less.
I was given a hire 'car' by my insurance company while mine was being repaired. I am nearly 70 and need a car to get around, so when my car went in for some repairs, the repair company stated that their courtesy cars were too small for me, (I am quite tall) Europcar were my insurers choice to give me a suitable car. They contacted me top say that they had not got an SUV as requested, but would give me something as close to an SUV as possible. What they supplied was a 9seater mini bus.
I tried to contact them to explain that the 'car' was not suitable but every time I called, I was constantly put on hold. I even completed their contact us form only for them to send me a standard reply email 2 weeks after the van had been returned. Do not accept anything from this firm unless you are happy with the size of vehicle and the condition. make sure that you take an all round video just in case they try to con you for damage that you have not caused.

CROOKS. Booked in advance but because they wouldnt accept different cards we had we were forced to take out their insurance for the week which was more than the cost of the car hire. We had arranged our own insurance at a tenth of the price but they would not even look at the paperwork. It was late with only a few other companies open and limited availability. When I asked why the insurance was so high they said it was a local insurance company. Never given a policy document just €268 item on the bill. We still had to pay a deposit. Read other reviews and see this is a common scam by them.

I arranged a hire of a Luton van and when it turned up the driver noticed someone had stolen the number plate ! They arranged for a LWB van to be delivered and this had a front tyre that was 1/3 bald ! The driver said you can take it to Kwikfit and they will change it for you , as it's our problem we willpay for it ! Oh yeah , sure I'm going to waste a few hours of my time for a problem caused by them. On top of that he said he saw the Luton was missing the number plate the day before , but thought he would keep quiet and not report it to the office !!! Unbelievable .... Then they would not answer the phone at the local depot and I did not get a hire at all ! I wish Trustpilot gave you the option to give a minus score s it would be -5 ! Don't use them is my recommendation.

False advertising from Europcar:

I booked an EV for a holiday in Spain. Online booking process says "full recharge not required" – but the collection desk argued I must recharge it before returning it.

They finally agreed when I showed them the website, and said they'd make a note on my booking. Obviously my choice was either sign the paperwork and trust them, or leave with no car for my holiday (plus they'd keep my deposit?).

So I had to trust them, and when I got home they invoiced me for recharging the car and took the payment from my credit card.

When I filed a dispute, they just replied saying that's the terms I agreed to when I signed. I keep asking about the false advertising, but they just ignore that question.

Won't use them again as this broke my trust.

We returned our car to Izmir Airport on 21/06/25, and as of 13/08/25 are yet to have our €300 security deposit returned.

We have made multiple phone calls and emails to attempt to get this resolved and are yet to hear anything back. We waited 30 working days, as advised, before emailing the Customer Service UK email address on 01/06/25, and only received a NoReply, automated response on 06/08/25 with no real update or additional information regarding our query- it was clear that it was sent automatically and not by a real person.

Europcar are contractually obliged to return this money to us, yet we do not have it- or any correspondence from them about it at all!

We will begin pursuing legal action if we do not hear back or receive our money back by the end of the week.

This is unfortunate because the car itself was lovely and the staff in Turkey very helpful, and the staff who assisted in making the booking were also helpful. We only went with Europcar because we believed them to be reputable, but will not be using them again after this experience.

If Europcar would like to reach out as a response to this review then I would very much welcome it, as all we really want at this point is our money back. I will be happy to provide our booking reference if so.

Very rude and unprofessional staff in booking process. 9th of July they 9 am they come collect car from may door 12 hours after I received text message from them said apologies for any inconvenience but we couldn't collect your rental vehicle today!!
And 24 hours after with out any notice they sent me invoice for damages front wheel alloy .
When they drop car for me before inspection take signature.
Terrible experience bo recommended them

Booked with europcar paid £276. They cancelled my booking with no explanation. I spoke to them on the phone they said I would receive a full refund with 5-7 days. They then refunded £206.00. I called to request the full refund. Customer service Carlos was obnoxious stating they need to do an investigation that will take 10 days no mention of refund. What investigation is needed all they need to do is look at the data £276 paid by customer and they returned only £206 clearly shown on bank statement. DO NOT USE THEY WILL STEAL YOUR MONEY. There is clearly some fraudulent activity happening in this company.

I had a prepaid car rental voucher for a predetermined type vehicle through a third-party provider. I went to collect the vehicle from EuropCar Gatwick South Terminal to be told by the female EuroCar employee that the vehicle we ordered was not available. She said “We are giving you a free upgrade”. No mention of cost we would pay etc. because we were told they were GIVING us an upgrade. GIVING! It is my understanding that under law, if the company cannot provide the car ordered (and paid for) they must offer either a free upgrade or a lesser vehicle with a monetary refund, The upgrade was a very luxurious vehicle and I was immediately resistant and anxious and expressed deep concern to her, I was told by the female agent not to worry, the vehicle was at the end of its rental life, it had 50,000 miles on the odometer, which it did, and it was to be disposed of when I returned it. Reluctantly I accepted it. I felt it had been foisted upon me. When I was outside loading the car, the female agent came out and said the car had damaged wheels and I had to sign a form to acknowledge the damage. She presented form with a diagram of the car, both sides, with X marks on the wheels. I now realise she had folded the paper in half so that I couldn’t see what was on the other side. I really thought the shonky, trickster days of car hire had long gone. Boy was I wrong!!!
In hindsight I should have said NO! NO! NO and I should have run away, screaming, and rung the third-party provider and complained, but I didn’t, fool that I am. However, after 26 hours of travel I was exhausted, and yes, I now know I was dimwitted not to spot a scam in the making.
I hated the car from the start. This car wrecked my entire holiday and nearly wrecked me. I was highly anxious when I drove it and it made me quite ill from worry, It was too large and too wide for UK parking spaces. It literally got stuck in the entry to a shopping centre car park. It gave my daughter high level anxiety attacks. I had to try to park it away from other cars because I was terrified they would dent the car’s doors. This car was just too big,and too wide for UK narrow roads, even some A roads were scary and it did things I found hard to accept. It was so technical it was dangerous, simply because it was distracting.
But just as importantly, mechanically it was difficult. When the car started off there were many times when it just didn’t want to change up gears. Leaving Cobham Services, the car wouldn’t change gears at all and I held my breath thinking I would need a tow truck, but eventually it did change up. I am used to driving a Subaru with CVT automatic, but this vehicle had a habit of just stopping and not moving off. It would stop and go into Neutral and once you realised why the car wasn’t moving and what had happened, you had to go through the set process to get it going again. This happened in dangerous places at times like waiting to enter a large roundabout on a 70mph road. A friend suggested I return the car and I jolly well wish I had.
On the day I had to return the car to Gatwick, a yellow message about the tyres appeared on the consol. 8 calls to EuropCar proved useless and so I drove just down the road to the local dealership for the marque. Service personnel said it was ok to drive it back and gave me instructions as to what to do with the gadget in the trunk should tyre pressure deteriorate. And this is how I returned the car.
During the term of the car hire I did check my credit card several times to see if EuropCar had levied the £1500 block for security and I was surprised they had not. I returned the car on 1 August and flew home. The day after I arrived home, I checked my credit card and found that at between the 29 July and 9 August (8 days after I had returned the car) EuropCar had charged me $3,630.06 in my money for the upgrade they told me they were GIVING me because they were unable to supply the car I had ordered and prepaid for. It was then that I remembered the woman who asked me to sign the document acknowledging the damage to the car, and it was then that I realised she had folded the document in half and therefore I could not see what was on the other side-the upgrade charges etc.What a Fool I am
I have lodged a dispute but EuropCarUK is notorious for completely ignoring disputes. I am told that what this woman did could be a criminal offence called Fraudulent Misrepresentation. Some could ask whether she is highly skilled in the dark arts of duplicity and deception? Of course I will not be letting this matter go and others in the travel and insurance industries have been advised. Eventually when I can confidently tell the Citizens Advice Bureau,Trading Standards,Watchdog and Rip-off Britain that EuropCar has done absolutely nothing to resolve my dispute,then I will lodge a dispute with the BVRLA to whom EuropCar belong.

Rented a car for 1 week - we landed early and collected the car 40 mins early- was not informed that this would incur and extra days charge - would have waited until the 11am time we had booked if we had been informed. Customer exploitation at its best

I booked a car for the month of August 25 and needed to make a small correction to the pickup location all other details remained the same - duration timings etc. I notified the customer care department almost immediately to explain the situation. I was subsequently notified that there was nothing they could do with 5 days notice before pickup and that I would either need to pick up the car as per the original booking or lose the rental money 840 pounds. I am on holiday, required the car for the duration of the holiday and was forced to rent another car whilst I contest the problem - simply ridiculous people.
I got no help from customer care, I raised a claim ( complaint) and was told the SLA for turnaround was up to 5 working days. Needless to say no reply to the complaint, it’s like pulling teeth with the zombies in customer care and now need to take them to an arbitration court.
Be very careful folk, this is a company that I have since found out are notorious for this type of thing and other abuses.
Will never touch these clowns again for the sake of my health.

What an absolute disgrace of a company . I am disabled and my car went in for repair so Europcar were the insurers choice for rental car . Rang and rang them for hrs for three days constant when this clown place was to arrange a vehicle for me . They rang and left a message seven days after and my car had been repaired and returned . I couldn’t go out while this disgusting company didn’t arrive with my rental . Worse company I’ve ever dealt with and have heard they regularly let disabled drivers down and are rude without any empathy !!!

We have had so much trouble with this company we are with Motability and three times we have had issues in the last month just trying to get a courtesy vehicle while our car goes into the garage.
No phone call from them to say they have a vehicle or they don’t just leaving us not knowing what’s going on. Would definitely not recommend if you are in need of a courtesy car or to talk to you just get fobbed off and then the line goes dead when they redirect you or they just don’t answer.

IMPORTANT !!! MAKE SURE CHECK YOU DOUBLE CHECK YOUR FINAL INVOICE AGAINST THE INITIAL PAPERWOK. I was charged for 2 days on my card having actually returned the vehicle same day having booked for 1 full day - this should simply not happen with telemetry data they have...!!!. I did complain on site and email and was 'thanked for my feedback !! ....' THANKED FOR MY FEEDBACK ???????? - no goodwill and a limp apology - DEFINATELY DO NOT RECOMMEND - STEER WELL CLEAR !!!! IM STILL AWAITING MY REFUND ....!!!!! POOLE BRANCH

Waited around 45 mins to collect from Palma. Charged 76 euros for a scuff to black plastic trim which was pre existing. Note: Europcar require the customer to phone a call centre to report any pre existing damage putting all the onus on the customer to scan the car and spend time during their holiday doing what I believe they should be doing themselves.
Waited in for car collection which kept being moved with no notification when I said how poor the customer services was the agent at Coventry hung up on me

We have been waiting at Dublin airport for 2 hours for car and it is still “ being washed” with no exact time as to when it will be ready. Staff friendly but not helpful - they just keep saying it’s other people’s faults for not returning car quick enough and they can’t give us a time frame!!! We have a disabled elderly person with us who needs to eat but staff unconcerned about this as we stand waiting in their crowded office for hours with no cafe anywhere nearby. We also have 4 people waiting in Dublin City for us so we will be missing the first half day of our holiday! I would definitely NOT recommend this company! I am watching people quickly collect their cars from other providers!
I wish I’d read reviews before booking with this company. I will never use again!

If I could rate as 0 I would do. Worst experience of any car hire company in my life. Our flight was delayed with Jet2 by 2 hours. They charged us for our flight being late. They checked the car over after the rental period, everything was fine and the employee signed the rental off. A month later we were charged £100 for out of hours, and £100 for our car needing to be cleaned. The Spanish guy we spoke to was like a robot and would not let us speak to a manager or give us a manager's email and only blandly gave us the basic customer services number. Please do not use this car hire firm. They are the worst sort of people to do business with and you could magically have £200 taken from your credit card and be in an utter battle to get it refunded.

We had to get a car from Eurocar as our mobility car needed to go in for repair. When handed back they charged my card 50 pounds, i disputed it and they said actually we should have been charged 30, still I would debate. I cancelled them taking anymore money from me but every couple of days they are trying to take 30 pounds remembering I have already overpaid and I am awaiting a refund. Customer service hang up now as we would like our refund instead of paying them money, formal complaint don’t reply. Receiving texts saying we owe them money. Been so stressful. I can’t believe the mobility scheme use them. This is a horrible experience. If you would like to feel abused then call Eurocar.

Disgusting service from the whole Europcar Team.
Scam organisation that have no regard for their customers.
Do not do business with them under any circumstances, you have been warned.
Add additional products without your knowledge and have no regard for their customers or make any attempt to resolve.
If I could have scored a ZERO I would have done.
I had an accident and my insurance company told me europcar would get a car to me. It’s been 5 days and I’m still no closer to getting a car from them. Shameful company they are!

We waited 5 days for a car I'm disabled and couldn't get to my appointment at the hospital ,husband could not get to work,we both kept getting chopped off the phone line after 20 minutes ,I don't think they can be bothered we won't use them again still no car they have also tried to give my husband a manual car when he has an automatic license are they thick or what .we won't use them again ever

I’m extremely disappointed with Europcar. When I picked up my car at Birmingham Airport, I clearly declined additional protection cover, as I had already purchased my own insurance.
Despite this, I was still charged £281.57 for an extra package I never agreed to. The agent made no effort to explain the charges, and I only realised later when the amount appeared on my invoice.
This feels like a deliberate upsell — especially knowing that staff may be incentivised to add extras. Europcar refused to refund me, so I’ve had to escalate to the BVRLA and my credit card provider.
Avoid unless you're prepared to challenge everything at the desk.
Not recommend ! Until today i didn’t get deposit back! Poor customer service! Please pay me back my money!

Rented from Europcar Luton Airport and had a terrible experience.

1️⃣ Hidden & Duplicate Charges
My booking clearly stated that Airport Surcharge and Vehicle Licence Fee were prepaid. But after returning the car, I was charged again for: Licenses and Fees &
Premium Station Surcharge

Europcar claimed these were “not charged again,” just shown again. Yet, £214.41 was deducted from my credit card — part of which they admit was £180.18 for Roadside Assistance, which I never intended to buy. That leaves £34.23 unexplained.

2️⃣ Misleading Upselling
Despite already having full insurance, I was pressured to buy Roadside Assistance at pickup. The staff explicitly told me it would not cost extra and was “included in the basic insurance.” This is clearly false and designed to exploit tourists unfamiliar with UK rental terms.

3️⃣ Admin Fees Without Proof
Charged £45 per “admin fee” for supposed fines or tolls — yet no evidence or notice was ever provided.

❗ Avoid Europcar. It will give you nothing but a deeply unpleasant experience. Nothing else.

Hired a prestige car from Stansted, paid for and all Ts&Cs read and agreed to. When I arrived, was told I wasn’t able to hire a prestige car as I hadn’t flown in to the airport, Stansted being my local hire centre. Followed up complaints online and with email and had ZERO response. Only reply I had back was contact via email or phone call as my online complaint hadn’t been resolved within 5 days. Europcar ruined my day. Avoid them like the plague.
Just read the majority of negative reviews and use at your own risk as they are appalling and will hit you with hidden charges and will not resolve any concerns.

Forced premium insurance

Rented a car for a week in Birmingham at EuroPcar

Had a full insurance over booking.com and when I arrived at the place to pick up the car, the staff just told me that their system can't accept the insurance that I bought over booking.com

The staff then forced me to buy one of their premium insurances before they would give me the keys to the car while then getting in contact with a person. They knew who to call at booking.com to force the cancelation of my insurance from there. My original price when I booked the car was around 60 pounds which then was changed to 250 + 100 in deposit.

The choice I had were 250 gbp + 100 gbp in deposit for full insurance
150 gbp + 200 gbp in deposit for half insurance
and the most outrages one was 87 gbp + 700 gbp in deposit for only windshield insurance

Had to talk with the support 3 times and on the second time I called in toto hear about the deposit. The lady on the phone just said I should wait and placed me on a waiting line just to end the call.
I tried it once more after half an hour and spoke with someone who tried to help me.

And just for the icing on top , I get a a late notification about a parking ticket when I dropped of my partner.
It was sent extremely late.

I rarely leave reviews, but my experience with Europcar was frustrating enough to warrant one.

First, when we arrived to collect our rental, we were expecting the MG ZS SUV we had booked months earlier. Instead, the woman at the desk tried to hand us a much smaller car — one that wouldn’t have fit our luggage. When we pointed this out, she suddenly offered us a van instead. We had to insist multiple times that we had paid for an SUV and expected what we reserved.

After “checking with the fleet manager” (twice), she miraculously located the exact vehicle we had booked — which had apparently been “unavailable” moments earlier. When we reached the car park, we saw at least half a dozen other MG ZS SUVs in plain sight, and another couple who had also just been given a van instead of the car they were promised.

Then came the handling of a parking fine administration fee. I had already successfully disputed the fine and notified Europcar with evidence before they charged my card. Despite this, they still took the £45 fee and made me chase them down multiple times — even rejecting a screenshot of the cancellation and demanding a PDF version of the exact same message. This is not how you treat a customer — especially one who proactively followed the rules and provided the relevant information in good faith.

If this is how Europcar handles both reservations and basic customer service, I’d strongly recommend choosing a different company.

On my recent rental from Europcar in the UK I was invoiced and charged for an additional 2 days, they decided that I collected the vehicle 2 days before I actually did. My card was charged and it took over 3 weeks to return the funds to my account.
The same rental also attempted to charge me for pre-existing damage that was "100% not there before I rented the vehicle", despite the damage being indicated on the rental agreement, they finally dropped the case when I provided photos and videos of the vehicle and the damage whilst the vehicle was at the collection depot.
Do not trust Europcar, they will try and rob you and if you prove that they are in the wrong they will offer no more than an insincere apology for the inconvenience.

Appalling and ongoing experience. We have our own excess Insurence as we travel regularly. Our car got a small scratch on thd side while we were away from it and it was parked. We had 950£ THEN another 700£ taken from our credit card then another bill for 1000euros.. The company claim they are looking into this as but dispite many calls we are no further forward and can't claim from our Insurence yet. DO NOT USE TJIS COMPANY!!!!!!!!

Hired a car from europcar in montpellier returned car with no damage except one stolen wheel cap, i assumed the hundred euros taken from my deposit covered that, also got a report back stating no damage except a scuff on the boot which we took a photo of on picking up the car, my partner had paid the bill on pick up but approx two weeks later they took 304 euros out of her bank account stating it was for damage, i put in a complaint and will see what happens, if the money is not returned i will contact the ECRCS just a warning for anybody contemplating hiring a car from these bandits.

Europcar have charged us 3 times instead of once for our booking. We paid on credit card and didn't realise until we got the bill which we are now obliged to pay to avoid interest charges so that is 100's of £. We reported this to Europcar 11 days ago and they are still "investigating" even though we sent them all the paper work highlighting their error straight away. VERY poor service all round.

Picked up a car in Stansted airport London. After we picked up the car we talked about that the talk we had with the sales guy at the pickup reception ended up more as he needed to sell us an upgrade than listen to our needs .... and we ended up with a car we actually didn't need. Not a good experience.

Picked up car from Italy - Rimini. Ordered a VW Tiguan, received a citreon of a completely different category (2 categories lower than what we ordered). Still not have received a refund for the difference.
Then returned the car within the permitted 29 minute grace period, the Europcar employee put on the Statement of Return that we returned the car 55 minutes late, completely false information and they have tried to charge us for an extra day - but we LUCKILY have the car parking ticket to prove this is wrong.

DO NOT USE IF YOU WANT A STRESS FREE HOLIDAY and without being falsely charged/stolen from

I booked a specific car class but was downgraded without any explanation. Not only was the replacement vehicle smaller and less comfortable, but I was also never offered a refund or compensation for the downgrade. My reservation number is 1182910408, Customer service has been unhelpful and unresponsive. This experience was frustrating and completely unacceptable — I expected better. I won’t be booking with them again.

Refused to honour my booking from the airport for car rental for a week (after I had already rented a car for a month, returned only days before). The reason given was that I did not have a confirmed return flight. I did not have a confirmed flight because I had to cancel the flight when the family member I was travelling with was urgently admitted to hospital and I did not know when they would be discharged. I understand the basis for the policy but staff claimed that nobody had any discretion on how to apply it and there was nobody who could be contacted with any discretion. I’ve used them a fair bit in the past but I never will again, obviously thinks very little of the care for their customers.

We have reported that sat nav in the car is not working, while choosing car it was crucial for us to have sat nav as we don't know the area. Response received,, After reviewing your rental documentation, we can confirm that there was no separate charge applied for the use of a sat nav. As such, no refund is due in relation to this feature. While some vehicles are equipped with built-in navigation systems, this is not a guaranteed feature unless explicitly booked and confirmed as an additional product,, THEY DO STATE ON THE WEB SAT NAV INCLUDED.
SOON THEY WILL START CHARGING EXTRAS FOR WHEELS BREAKS AND STEERING WHEEL!!! APPALLING!!!

This company, kept us waiting for 90 minutes in Dublin, because they tried to sell everyone upgrades, bigger cars, automatic,s and took 2.5k off unsuspecting customers, even after they spent 70£ with ryanair, while booking the hire car, then to be told they dont honour 3rd party insurers. A complete disgrace, we missed our appointment, then missed a ferry, for no good reason.. avoid this company, they had 100 customers waiting and only 20 seats.. they offered a customers who was in front of me the car i already booked, and told me then there were none left, and gave me a car I didn't book.. unbelievable... avoid these rip off merchants
A band of crooks, along with their fakes and delinquent solicitors. Stay MILES away, use a horse a bike but NEVER NEVER THESE band of delinquents.

After our motability car breaking down we were given a hire car from europcar.
When it was dropped off it had all the usual checklists ticked on leaflets etc
It consequently broke down when we were on our way out..NO OIL IN CAR!
After waiting for recovery they told me the engine was cooking..and it needed oil asap..not to use...great 2nd car to breakdown! I then had to walk to the other side of town to BUY MY OWN OIL!!
Which was ridiculous.
The car was left at the new dealer fuelled up n clean..only for them to remove £69 out my bank without telling me what it was for..then they said oh we charged you wrong amount.. making me overdrwn. Countless phonecalls and a month later and I'm STILL waiting for compensation which I keep getting told 7 working days, 7 working days email only, another team are dealing with it WHATEVA!..totally fed up with the lot of them.
Disgusting customer service..would not recommend to my worse enemy
Having put a formal complaint in when my partner was having a suspected stroke at the time..still waiting...
Outrageous company AVOID!

Don’t go anywhere near them! Such a dodgy company.

Was forced into paying for the damage waiver in France as the operative simply would not stop badgering, knew I was in a rush and refused to give me the keys until I purchased the upgrade.

They tell you not to bother inspecting the car because you won’t be charged. THIS IS NOT TRUE. Dropping the car off there was a scratch on the paintwork which looked historic. Whilst I accept I should’ve checked and said something, I relied on what I was told that I didn’t need to check. I highlighted that the scratch looked historic and the operative at the other end even agreed. He told me to simply sign the form saying we’d spoken about it and not to worry as I wouldn’t be charged anyway as I had signed the damage waiver.

Well, I wake up to a £100 “damage admin fee” - so I was charged. With my invoice I had a link to press to complain, this sent me to a form that I completed. The response to that form was “you’ve contacted the wrong Europcar, you need to contact Europcar France not Europcar UK”.

The buck-passing began there. I asked repeatedly why I wasn’t allowed to rely on the representations made that I wouldn’t be charged both before I signed the contract and after and was told the T&C’s applied (which was in direct contradiction to what I was told). The response was only “you signed the form acknowledging the damage”. If I had known about the charge (and gone against what 2 members of staff said too my face), I wouldn’t have signed it.

Beware. Beware. Beware. They will hoodwink you, pressurise you and after all of that, still charge you. Hidden fees are their speciality it seems.

Will never touch Europcar again and I can only recommend you do the same.

Don't expect them to answer the phone. They were supposed to be dropping off a car for us to collect from the dealer whilst our car is being repaired. They called us at 10.00 in the morning - it's now 17.45, the dealership closed 15 minutes ago & my wife has spent a frustrating hour trying to get hold of them.
We've finally got hold of them to be told that the car is at the (closed) dealers & the dealer have the keys. No contact from them to tell us it was on its way or had been delivered.
I'm in a meeting 20 miles up the road at 08.00 tomorrow - the dealer opens at 08.30.
Smashing 👍

Absolute scummy company. Tricked into signing a rental that doubled my initial quoted price after an all night flight. Company refuse to make amends after repeated interactions. Beware of this scam company who will try to bleed you dry at every opportunity.

Ordered a car for this morning from newcastle branch as my car was going to garage and it still not arrived ...rang them at Newcastle and woman on the phone had the most fowl attitude and said we get there when we get there...avoid this company they are terrible ...I would even give this company 1 star if this is the attitude you get when ordering a car...

Last night I flew to England from the Netherlands to visit my dying father. Despite the fact I'd already paid online for the booking and had all the mandatory documents outlined in the confirmation email, the customer service reps from Europcar wouldn't let me pick up the car from Luton Airport because I didn't have a return flight booked (due to the fact I didn't yet know when my dad would die, when the funeral would take place, etc.). They cancelled my booking. I had to hire a car from another company at three times the price. I will never use Europcar again.

Posting this as a warning to other customers of Europcar's Park Royal branch in North West London.

Having used this outfit twice, it appears that their usual practice is not to carry out any kind of pre-hire walk around with the customer. On the second of the two occasions I hired a car here, this lack of a pre-hire check was used in an attempt to make me pay for pre-existing damage to the wheel and tyre. The person I handed the car back to spotted this very minor blemish so quickly that I can only assume that they knew it was there and needed someone to pin it on.

However, while Europcar doesn't do pre-hire checks, I do and I had photos to prove that the damage was there when I collected the car. The person I handed the car over to couldn't have been less interested in this despite this being an opportunity to wrap things up there and then. He was clearly desperate to pass this up the chain, claiming that he would get in trouble if he didn't.

The matter was passed to Europcar's damage team, who are slow, incompetent and impertinent. After almost a month of exchanges, Europcar have gracelessly and grudgingly conceded that they were wrong and I've been informed that I will not be charged for damage that someone else caused.

I certainly won't be using this shady outfit again. If you do, I'd strongly advise you to take a comprehensive and clear photographs of every aspect of the car, interior as well as exterior photographs. Time stamp them if possible. If I hadn't done this I'd have been a few hundred pounds out of pocket.

Absolutely shocking new policy!! Would like to give no stars at all. My daughter having flown from Australia where she works at the moment hired a car to pick up from Stanstead Airport, on arrival was told that she could not hire the vehicle as she didn’t have a return flight booked ! this was because she had come home as her father was in a hospice dying so no time scale available, despite being a British Citizen, having paid with credit card at home Uk address and hired from here before was still told no therefore stranding her at the airport . I cannot believe that this policy is even in place , what a dreadful company

I rented a van for 5days in May 25 from Truro. It was returned in the same condition as at pickup.
In July my credit card was de bited a further£180 with no explanation. Customer service is non existence. They do not reply. I would not recommend anyone to use this company they are thieves.

I would like to give a review about my experience at Europcar by Birmingham airport today. The front desk employee named “Bryan” (black guy at desk) mistreated me and my uncle so badly today. I came to the branch desperate for a car as I broke down and I needed something for the morning to commute to work. The first thing Bryan told me and reassured me was dont worry we have enough cars for you today and showed me all the cars they had in the carpark. I felt a bit better because thats what I needed to hear. Once he found out that Im desperate for a car as I broken down and once he found out what do I do for work everything changed. So online it was showing they have availabity for an Audi A3 coming all together around £250 for 4 days (second driver included) I did not book it online as I was unsure if they accept debit or credit card. So I turned up to the branch, even then I needed my uncle to book as I am currently waiting for my debit card to come home so in this case he would pay , and I can transfer him the money and I can drive to work.
Let’s go back at the point when “Bryan” found out how desperate I was for a car. He only offered me a Fiat punto for first £389, (after I told my uncle to make way and come to the branch) then I asked him how come online it says I can get an audi for almost half the price he said no you cannot no you cannot without giving me an answer as I was confused. Fair enough he wanted me to pay double, my uncle asked a question so which other cars do you have and Bryan looked at him weird asking for translation as my uncle english is not perfect but he is a manager at a wholesale place I can assure he has a degree, who is Bryan to make joke of his english?. This completely made me think he was being racist to us. I then asked, ok so what if I book a car for 2 hours later as per online procedure and it was showing I can get an A3 for £250 for 4 days what would you do then if you saying you cannot give me that one as its gone? He did not bother giving me a proper answer and instead of helping me save money or finding a solution to my problem he decided to just say mate you can have the Fiat punto for £456 now or I’ll just tell you to walk out mate. What? So the price gone up for me asking few questions or my uncle asking a question?
THIS IS NOT HOW YOU TREAT A CUSTOMER IN NEED OF HELP, I DO NOT KNOW WHO GAVE TRAINING TO THIS GUY BUT PEOPLE AT DESKS ARE MEANT TO HELP CUSTOMER AND NOT CHARGE EXTRA EXTORTION PRICES. IM REALLY DISAPPOINTED IN THIS EXPERIENCE AS I WASTED ALMOST 3 HOURS OF MY TIME AND ALL I GOT IN RETURN WAS THIS GUY TRYING TO SHOW HIS POWER AND BE RACIST TO MY UNCLE PLUS STRESS TO FIND A CAR FOR MORNING. Really disappointed in you guys, because of Bryan I will have to catch a taxi early in the morning and back home. Meanwhile the other guy at the desk was the opposite, he went home at 7.30/8 pm but was willing to help his attitude was really nice I wish he stayed and dealt with my query. Also the guy bringing the cars was really kind too. Bryan Instead he could have decided to help me saying, mate book it for the morning or tomorrow online it might be cheaper or better cars etc….Is this how you treat customers in need of help? Charge extra amounts to show your powers? I have rented cars of you guys before and a lot of my friends and family have in the past hence I came. But after this experience with BRYAN do you think they would want to book again?

I booked a car online with everything confirmed and paid in advance. At the counter, I clearly declined extra services and only requested prepaid fuel.

Despite that, I was later charged for an additional insurance I never agreed to, followed by another unexpected charge after returning the car — with no explanation or invoice. On top of this, my deposit was never refunded!!!

I contacted customer service multiple times via email. To this day, no one has responded.

Extremely poor experience, lack of transparency, and zero customer support. I cannot recommend this company.

Be wary using this company.

I booked my car through Expedia. However, upon collection at London Heathrow the price was considerably higher. When I questioned this I was told it would be resolved when the car returned and final invoice produced. A week later I have been billed the overcharged amount and neither Expedia nor Europcar willing to sort it out. In fact Europcar wrote to me saying they would not honor the Expedia pricing.

Unethical and dishonest. Not a company I will be using again and I warn anyone booking to be wary too.

If I could give 0 I would.
Our experience with this company was deeply frustrating and disappointing from start to finish. The customer service is absolutely appalling — no one was willing to take responsibility or even attempt to resolve the issues we faced. Every time we reached out for help, we were either ignored or passed around with no real support.

We were also given completely incorrect information about petrol prices, which led to us paying far more than necessary for the journey we took. When we raised this, it was brushed off without any accountability.

To make matters worse, there was a problem with the car itself — and again, no one wanted to assist. We were left to deal with the situation on our own, with no guidance, apology, or even basic courtesy.

I strongly advise others to avoid this company. Do not hire from them. The service is unprofessional, unreliable, and not worth the hassle or the cost.

The longest wait I have ever had for a hire car - it was inconceivable the amount of time they took to deal with people. Then there was a problem with my booking and we had to start again. They refused to allow me to use my own insurance. They were uncontactable after the hire to discuss a lost jacket. An absolute shower . . . And very expensive. They also misled me about there being no petrol stations nearby in order to encourage me to take their fuel pre- paying service.

Provided a courtesy car from them via insurance following an RTC.
Arrived with the driver saying “ you won’t like it” , well that was a good start.
The car was fine, arrived with a full tank of petrol etc.
had it for 10 days, I called to say we had our own car back following repairs and I was told the courtesy car would be picked up the following day at a certain time.
No sign of them.
No answer to my calls.
Wasted a full day waiting in for any form of contact.
Well they can have it back at my convenience now.
Avoid if you can .

Worst hire company ever. Taken extra petrol out of bank. When we had filled up the tank bank up. Querying this further! Only had the vehicle for 17 days. No way on this earth had we used extra petrol, what petrol we used we put back in.
Booked a vehicle, Europcar then rang me and cancelled it, still waiting 6 weeks later for my £272 I paid online to be refunded. Absolute joke!!

Your company/branch (Woodford Green, Essex, UK) is a total disgrace.

I was called only three minutes before I was due to collect a large van. James (Jimmy) explained that only a smaller wheelbase van was available but that I would be receiving £30 as compensation.

Months later and I still have not received the promised money. The manager was there and was extremely apologetic, but still hasn't bothered to keep to his word.

This branch is a mess and I'd give zero stars if I could! Honestly disgusted with how I've been treated and I hope you'll consider the above and look elsewhere; especially if you require a long wheelbase van.

0/10.

Unfortunately our experience with Europcar was not good. Upon collection of the car they added £250 of extra charges including Gozen. The document we signed was in French and when I queried the increased price I was told it was due the security deposit and no money would be debited but it was !
Europcar have no interest in refunding me the money despite the fraud. Go elsewhere unless you want to be ripped off.

Booked a vehicle via booking,com for 10 days at Olbia airport Sardinia DEPOT returned on 30th june. Checked and signed off no issues.
STILL WAITING 25 DAYS LATER FOR MY 500 euros deposit back robbing bastards now seeking my lawyers with FCA told as non UK its takes 28 days. What utter bollox !! FCA sort these thieves out !!

I hired a vehicle from Europcar and had to top up the engine oil during the rental because the car was running low — not ideal, considering it should have been checked before hire. I contacted Europcar at the time and was told I would be reimbursed for the oil purchase.

I provided the receipt as requested, but since then I’ve been ignored. No refund, no reply, and no explanation, despite multiple follow-ups.

It’s not about the small amount of money — it’s the principle. If Europcar can’t follow through on a basic reimbursement they agreed to, I’d question how they handle more serious issues.

Disappointing experience. If you value accountability and clear communication, I’d think twice before booking with Europcar.

Been charge for fuel when i returned the van with a fuel tank.
Everyone is ignoring my call and email, they put me on hold when I call then end the call.

I rented a car abroad in Thailand in March I have not received my deposit back and it’s July. I have contacted customer service multiple times and they have been no help saying they are unable to find my booking.

Europcar Heathrow.
Arrived off a 32-hour flight from New Zealand. Tired and disorientated I arrived at the desk ready to produce my CarTrawler.com voucher for the 30-day rental. This was not required, apparently. I asked about an upgrade to a car with automatic transmission and was told that one was available at an additional 25 GBP per day. I was told by Danielle that because she was not (now) going to be charging me for the additional driver (upon the return of the vehicle) that additional cost would only ‘feel’ like 5 GBP per day as the additional driver would have otherwise been charged at 20 GBP per day. We signed the documents, drove away and then 30 minutes later realised we’d been well and truly conned by Danielle.

The cost of the additional driver, for the original vehicle or for the upgrade was NOT 20 GBP per day (or 600 GBP in total). It’s only 186 GBP for the whole period (according to their website) for the upgraded vehicle. I phoned Customer Services from a service station on the M5, who also said that the 186 was too cheap and it they’d never offer an additional driver for less that 13 GBP per day.

So, having already paid 1,034 GBP for the original vehicle I was stung for another 1,035 GBP for the upgrade. The payment was taken out of my bank account, and this prompted an email to their customer services. Several emails later, during which I was told that “You’ve signed the documents, so you had to pay”, and that “I (the customer service rep) was not there when you had the conversation with Danielle, so I can’t confirm or corroborate what was said and so can’t offer a refund for the difference” etc etc, it went on.

The upgrade vehicle, should I have booked that originally, would have cost me 1,390 +186 = 1,576. I was conned out of 492 GBP. I wasn’t asking for a refund for the whole amount, just this difference. I would have been happy to pay the correct price for the vehicle that I had.

The whole ‘show’ was a farce. “For this deal I need to get my manager to sign this off. It’s that good” (Danielle). The whole things was a well-practiced hustle.

This whole experience really played on my mind for the whole of my holiday in the UK. This experience and realisation of their wrongdoing was something I was unable to reconcile with.

Avoid, avoid, avoid. I hope my that by writing this I can help others to avoid a similar experience.

Reply from Owner following my Google review . .
"Hello David,

We appreciate your feedback and we are sorry to learn you were dissatisfied with our service.

Give us the chance to solve the issue by providing more details using this link **** where our customer service team will be in touch."

Total waste of time. No change in stance, just "Europcar UK have provided you with an explanation for the fee you raised. Based on the information available and the explanation from Europcar UK, we regret to inform you that the upgrade fee is valid and cannot be waived."

Terrible experience. I booked and paid for an SUV just three hours before pickup, only to arrive and be offered an electric car I never requested. When I declined, I was rudely dismissed and then told the only option was a tiny Fiat 500 — completely unsuitable for a family.

Other customers were facing the same issue, including those who had booked weeks in advance. The staff were rude, unhelpful, and took a “tough luck” attitude with everyone. I was even told it was my fault for booking “too late” — despite their system accepting my payment and confirming availability.

The whole experience was chaotic, unprofessional, and completely ruined the start of our family holiday. I had to get a refund and find an alternative at the last minute. Easily the worst customer service I’ve ever experienced. Never again.

Steer clear. There are enough car hire companies around to choose from. Hire car returned, and recieved a call, whilst on holiday, saying I owed money for a fine for a toll road. I knew it wasn't right, but I was bullied into paying it, as it was my ex partners card on the car and I did not need the hassle.
When I got home, I contacted the toll company, to find that there was an error and the fine had been quashed. I contacted Europcar and was told they would look into the refund.

Two weeks later, still no refund and no response to my formal complaint. They were quick enough to bully me into paying the fine, but not so quick to refund what they owe me.

Awful customer service, with absolutely no idea how to help me get a resolution, other than to say someone will be in touch within 5 days!

Will not be using these again and would not recommend

Worst experience ever! Quick to take your money but not quick to provide you with any help. I rented a car out and extended it. They emailed me on the morning of my last day stating that the vehicle insurance was no longer valid and that the vehicle was overdue although I had paid. They then took out 2 identical payments of 83.34 from different branches and a further payment of 178 after I had complained and they had ensured that my case was being looked in to. Now they are taking forever to respond and not looking in to my case with urgency although they have taken roughly £500 for no reason

Car hire in itself was ok but at the checking in process the staff member tried to upgrade as we had booked flights through Ryan air. After several minutes of selling, the upgrade would have cost a ridiculous amount so we stuck with our original car. The real bug bear is that we verbally agreed to return the car with a full tank of petrol, which we refilled at Birchanger services next to Stansted. Expecting a refund of the fuel deposit we paid of £47.04 and after re fuelling at a further cost of £18.63 thus totalling £65.67. Did we receive the deposit back, No. We contacted Europcar who opened a case but sadly even though the vehicle showed we had refilled the car to the exact amount that was in the tank originally they would not refund the deposit. This seems to us to be extremely unfair. Be very wary.

Hired car on the website
Was called saying that the car was not available when I triedto cancel they tried to charge a cancellation fee for there mistake

I rented a van from Europcar on the 13th of June and returned it the following day, the 14th. While I’ll admit their vehicles are quite lovely and modern, that’s about the only good thing I can say. The rest of the experience was a full-blown disaster.
I used the van to move boxes to my new house, driving a total of just 38 miles. However, when I went to refill the tank before returning it, I had to put in 14.61 litres of diesel. That’s laughably excessive. For context, I drive a diesel SUV 64 miles round-trip to work daily, and that uses only 4–5 litres. So how did 38 miles in a van burn through nearly triple that?
The answer is simple: the vehicle wasn’t filled up properly when I received it. The digital fuel gauge can be deceiving, giving the impression of a full tank even when it’s not. I mentioned this immediately upon return, only to be told that maybe the heavy boxes I moved caused it. A flimsy excuse at best.
I raised a formal complaint online on June 15th, expecting the promised "7 working day" resolution. It's now well past that, and I’ve received nothing but silence and disgraceful customer service. I've been hung up on twice after providing my complaint reference, and on one occasion, I was subjected to the rudest, most unhelpful call imaginable. Not once did anyone seem remotely interested in resolving the issue.
If you're thinking of using Europcar, don’t unless you’re prepared to be ignored, insulted, and treated like a nuisance the moment you raise a concern. Their complaint process is more like a black hole. Once you're in, expect no return.
Avoid Europcar. Their shiny cars hide a rusty, soulless machine underneath.

I hired a car from Europcar for 10 days at a cost of £380. Almost immediately after booking, I realised I needed the car for 12 days instead. I phoned their call centre and was told not to amend the booking — just to call back once I had the car, and they’d add the extra 2 days at £38 per day. Sounds simple, right? It wasn’t.

Two days into the hire, I called to extend the booking by 2 days — exactly as instructed — and was told I’d have to pay £420. That’s more than the original £380 for 10 days, just for 2 more days! Even more outrageous, I checked online and the same car was available for £170 over the same 2-day period.

When I asked why, I was told the only option was to return the vehicle all the way back to Edinburgh Airport (a 140-mile round trip for me), start a new booking, and drive off again — all for something I was told could be handled over the phone for an additional £80 total.

I raised this as a complaint and was told to contact the Edinburgh depot directly. After 5 separate attempts and 5 hours on hold over 2 days, I gave up — which I suspect is exactly what they count on.

I went back to the main number and asked to speak with customer service, only to be told:
“It’s what the computer says — there’s nothing we can do.”

Absolutely disgraceful service, zero accountability, and pricing that borders on predatory.
BE AWARE before booking with Europcar.

Avoid Europcar Stansted at All Costs – Scam Artists!

I booked a car through Ryanair for €150, thinking I was getting a fair deal. Once I arrived at the Europcar desk at Stansted, the nightmare began.

They tried every trick in the book to confuse me and inflate the price – hidden fees, invented extras, unclear explanations. It felt like I was being hustled in a market stall, not a professional rental company.

In the end, I ended up paying three times the original price just to add a second driver and get full coverage – things that should have been clear and reasonably priced from the beginning.

This is not just bad service – it’s borderline fraud.
Run away from Europcar Stansted. Don’t fall into the same trap.

I hired a car from Trieste Ronchi Airport on 22 June 2025, and returned it in Bologna on Thur. 26 June.

The pick up process went OK, but the car's conditions were worse than those described on the contract. This forced me to take something like 18 pictures of various damages and return to the office to report one of them in particular. This was particularly unpleasant as I had to do this under the scorching sun at about 37 degrees; it would be greatly appreciated if Europcar could rent some parking slots in the shade.

But the worst was still to come. The documentation I had been emailed when I booked contained 2 different addresses where to return the car in Bologna. When I asked about this on the pick-up day, the person behind the desk (Sig.ra Ilenia) said that, actually, both of these addresses were wrong, and gave me a third address ("V. Matteotti, 5 - Bologna"). She mentioned that, when I reached the car park, I should go to level -1. That was it.

On the last day, car return time was 15:00. Google map said it would take me 15 minutes to drive to the alleged return address (Via Matteotti, 5); I left at 1:45pm (1h 15min early).
Indeed, after less than 20 mins, I reached "via Matteotti"; however, when I started looking for no. 5, there was no “no. 5” anywhere. The numbering jumped from no. 1 to no. 7; in between, there was a huge bridge over the railway, and, after the bridge, Bologna's main Railway Station's car park.
The car park entrance had no indication suggesting that this might *also* be the place where rental cars had to be returned. There was NO Europcar sign to be seen anywhere, nor were there any other rental companies' signs, which would have hinted this could have been the correct location.

I stopped and called Europcar office in Bologna for some indications. It was about 2:10-15pm. Nobody answered. I tried several times, for about 5 minutes, but nobody picked up.

The clock was ticking. Given that I had 3 (three) different addresses where to return the car, and that, amongst those, one was Europcar's main offices', I decided to drive there, as the address placed it nearby.
After another 10 minutes, I managed to locate Europcar's office entrance, parked, and walked there.

It was 14:30, under a scorching sun (37 degrees C). When I got there, the office was closed. The sign on the door said "14:30" as the afternoon opening times. I waited for a few minutes, while occasionally ringing the bell, and insistently knocking on the office door.
No answer. Nobody was visible through the glass windows.
It was now past 14:35, the return time was approaching, and the door remained closed. I tried to call Europcar's office number again: no answer.
At that point I noticed a small sign (written in Italian) next to the office's door, stating that, should the office be closed, the car key should be dropped off at Europcar's car park located in the ** main train station's car park ***. It was now clear that Bologna's rail station car park was where Europcar also had its own car park.

But the calvary wasn't over. I drove the car to the train station car park, went to level -1 (where, finally, a "Europcar" sign showed up) and parked.
I had a look around, but there were no signs as to where to find the key drop box; there were no Europcar's desks anywhere. I walked to the top / ground floor, found a railways office, where a staff member of the national railways very kindly told me he believed the key box was on floor -1. He was not a Europcar staff, so he wasn't supposed to know this. I assume he knew as he had already come across tens of people who, like me, were looking for the same piece of information.
I then went back to level -1, where I found two other people equally lost and looking for the drop box: someone else had told them that it was at level -2, not -1. I decided to believe the railways staff member (for the reasons above) and we started walking around on level -1. Finally, in a very remote, dark corner of the car park, partly hidden by other cars, there it was, Europcar's key drop box.
It was now 2:55pm; I was drenched in sweat, and had spent 45' of my time doing this.

To sum up:
1. Europcar's office *never* answered any of my calls; I tried also later in the afternoon, repeatedly. This is simply a disgrace;
2. The documents I was sent contained 2 different addresses where to return the car, both incorrect;
3. Car conditions: some of the issues were not noted on the report I was given at car pick up;
4. When I picked up the car, Europcar staff (Sig.ra Ilenia) did not clarify that the return car park happen to coincide with Bologna's main train station car park;
5. Europcar's sign posting is abhorrent. A small sign next to the train station car park's entrance would have made this so much easier, as would some sign posting to the key drop box.

Overall, I will never hire a car with Europcar again.

My wife with our young baby found that the vehicle she had reserved (with a child’s car seat etc) was not available. They had an alternative vehicle, which they said it was €60 more per day. After a heated debate, because if you don’t have the vehicle the customer has reserved. Surely that should be complimentary, it was agreed that €20 surplus per day was agreed.Predatory company. When they opened a few days later, they confirmed they were in error & I should not have been denied rental - but it was way too late by then.

Absolutely appalling systemic incompetence on Europcars part.
