After second time I decided not to get anything from them but one of the colleagues insisted that they have improved now but doesn’t look like they are even worse.

Booked a car for a road trip in Italy and everything went well except £600 extra is taken from my card upon returning the car without being noticed. Staff has said nothing when I return the car so the extra charge comes to a surprise. The claim form online is broken and now will have to make long calls to try to get the money refunded. DO NOT BOOK WITH THEM

Stay clear of this mob...They are a total joke they don't tell you the add ons a car a booked for 130 has ended up costing 350..250 before ypu get out with your car you need to take there insurance or 2500 on your credit card if anything goes wrong and was running late tank was at 3/4 full so it changed me 87.00 to top up unbelievable
.Plus the motors have had more hits than beatles

They’ve left me with a tyre that can blow-out at any moment!!!

Car was dropped off from their Leeds branch to York. On pickup the car had a lot of damage but that doesn’t matter as all noted - photos taken including the horrific alloy conditions. After having driven 250 miles, the next morning I check the vehicle over before setting off on a business trip and notice a huge chunk of rubber missing from the tyre. I check and the damage was there from drop off - you can literally see the tyre cords. I could have had a major tyre blowout on a motorway. I have now called Europcar 6 - 6!! Times in the space of 2 hours and STILL no resolution. If nothing gets resolved I am leaving the car at the hotel and will be claiming the taxi and railway costs from Europcar. I need to get back home and will not drive a car that has major sidewall damage. This will be going straight to the ombudsman due to the utterly unsafe condition they have supplied this car in.

Rented a car for 3 days. Paid basic insurance, returned it like new. Charged us £106 for a scratch in the wheel that we couldn’t even see in the picture they sent us. Asked for more pictures and they ignored us. We will NEVER be using their services again and we will not recommend it to anyone.

I wouldn't even give a 1 star. What an absolute shambles of a company. Why anyone would choose to deal with them is beyond me. A bunch of monkeys would do a better job. No wonder they have low star ratings. I don't even have any more words to really describe them. Absolutely ridiculous and shambolic!!!!

We arranged to pick up a hire car at Alghero Airport in Sardinia for a five day hire period. All was going well and a set of keys were set out for us. This was UNTIL the rep realised we had purchased fully comprehensive insurance and that both husband and wife would be driving. The key was swiftly removed from us and we were handed keys to a Dacia Sandero. All I can say is that this car looked like it had been owned by a succession of learner drivers. There were scratches and dents everywhere and the car wasnt particularly clean inside. The tyres were barely legal and in a bad state for the dusty roads. Total deception on our side as we paid over £500 for this experience (and were parked next to the shiny new Peugeot we were meant to be picking up). Will not ever use this company again and will be watching the credit card carefully now following other reviews.

Do not use this company!!!! I booked and paid for a hire car in advance, travelling from Australia to London. Unfortunately, I got my flight times mixed up and was late collecting the car. I didn't think it'd be a problem, as I'd already paid for it. BUT if you are more than 1 hour late you forfeit your booking with no refund! (should have read all the small print) Being stuck with no car, kids and a three week holiday in front of me, I had to hire another car and pay a much higher additional cost—complete nightmare and very expensive. I'm NEVER using the company again.

I was told it's now IMPOSSIBLE to book a small car from Glasgow, unless you pay extra. I'm a Europcar regular - I'm looking at my online record and I see ten rentals in the last two and a bit years. These are private retals, spanning Portgal, France, Germany, Spain and the UK.
I booked a Compact car ('Cupra Leon or similar' - that's a small hatchback. As on my last trip to Scotland, I was instead given a dreadful, wallowy, absolutely huge MG SUV. I asked for a smaller car at the desk, and was told I could have a BMW 1 series - for an extra £30 a day. I was told it's not possible to get the car I asked for without going premium - instead I had to put up with a bloated, rubbishy Chinese SUV.
To make things worse, the car stank of cigarettes - some previous user had been smoking in it. I complained before I drove away, and it was recorded (so I wouldn't have to pay for the damage - probably impossible to clean effectively) but I wasn't offered a change of vehicle.
Still, at least there wasn't a queue. On two receent trips - to Toulouse in France in June, and to Portugal in April - I had to queue for more than an hour to collect the keys. There's no 'Privilege' desk any more for regular customers - no reward for customer loyalty, for filling out details in advance to speed things up. No, you queue with all the people who need every last comma on the contract explained to them, while staff try their hardest to up-sell. EVERY. STUPID. TIME.
Anyway I'm getting utterly fed up with Europcar, I noted that queues at some other rental places are much shorter. I don't know if Hertz or Avis have a functioning loyalty programme but I might give them a try.
I moved to the Europcar app after using brokers for years, after two unforunate experiences (with Greenmotion in Edinburgh, and Goldcar in Italy - the latter now ironically a Europcar brand) where I was ripped off for non-existent damage I didn't do. I have a global excess policy that I use everywhere from the US to Taiwan and Japan, as well as across Europe. But these two were the only times it's been triggered. To be fair, Europcar haven't ripped me off in this way. It's a credible brand. But customer service has not recovered from COVID and it seems it may well be time to move on.

I originally booked a van for 6 days and went over a few hours. So they charge me for 1 extra day, which is fair enough but what they didn’t tell at all until I confronted them about the extra 700 miles in charges! My booking was 6 days/ 1500 ml. This is 250 ml a day. Because I went over a few hours they change the mileage allowance to 90 per day which meant I was over 700 mos. Very deceiving. Never again I will hire from them. Also Bristol south not very nice people. In the end they charge me an extra 144£ for bringing the van a day later. Completely out of order!

I have only given them 1 star because I cannot give nil. The most useless bunch of incompetents in the world. Do not use them! Was given a hire car by them whilst mine was in for repair. Told to call them to arrange collection when finished with to arrange collection. Can only call central number who could not organise collection every time they tried to put me through to the local depot I was sent back in a circle to the incompetents on the central line. Eventually after an hour calling these buffoons I gave up and called my insurance company direct. Do not use these if you value your sanity. A central number is no good if they can’t do anything and transfer you to someone who can! Br told they will put it in your notes repeatedly is no use- I just want it downhired and collected!
Was told it would be £123 to hire a car for 1 week then they took £700 out my bank account after I returned the car! Scammers and con men is what this company are

Sent me a car which was totally unsuitable and customer service is appalling.
Avoid at all costs if you can

Worst company ever. Customer service is a waste of time.they all need retraining in customer service, we had a car from europcar through motability. Took the car back to the dealership when I picked my own car up at 10.30am. Took europcar four weeks to txt me to say their was damage to the left passenger door, no damage when I returned the car , opened a dispute .no communication whatsoever, then recieves a letter saying damage was caused at 1.15 pm how they knew the time the damage was caused is beyond me , I returned the car at 10.30 yet the damage was caused at 1.15? They couldn't answer my question as to how do they know the time the damage was supposed to have taken place, still in a dispute .until they can prove i caused the damage when I didn't even have the car .
Avoid this company

Hired a car at Manchester Airport March 2025 for about 15 days. We had prepaid in Australia, or so we thought. The staff were quite friendly however when we returned to Australia we had been charged a huge amount over and beyond what was expected, considering we had prepaid. Tried to contact customer service a number of times with no response apart from the usual computer generated response. Very disappointed.

The worst hire company ever car broke down AA turned up wrong customer services they got no answer. They don’t know what to do. They haven’t got any instructions. They say made a complaint about the car before I picked up. That’s the wrong size. The staff are Slough branch was absolutely rude. Horrible people never again left me stranded on the road with no vehicle.

Car was perfect, pick up and drop off great. However not one for extra insurance normally I was encouraged to take the £28.70 to protect my excess.
OMFG! It was PER DAY 😭 Then don’t forget the hidden charge for picking up from an airport?!
On what planet does it cost an extra £208 to hire a car dwarfing the original cost.
Disgusting pricing strategy that will exclude Europcar from any further business of mine. Joke of a business!

DON'T book your hire car with Europcar!! I was charged for a non-existent scratch after jointly inspecting the car with their representative and being told all was fine 😡

Europcar have previously been investigated by the UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) for similar post-rental billing practices, including charging customers for damage without proof of repairs.

Absolutely shocking service, have currently spent 5 hours of a precious holiday trying to resolve an issue, car has fault light on it, advised by AA not to drive , now onto my 8th call to arrange a replacement, awful awful service, children and family unable to continue with holiday. Why can no one simply change the car !

Never again! The worst car rental company. Do not book with them!
I just spent 3.5 hours travelling to Europcar Croydon just to find out that I cannot pick up my car as I needed to get an address check. This was neither mentioned nor highlighted to me when I booked the car. I haven’t only wasted a lot of time today I have also wasted money travelling to and back from Europcar. When I asked Shantee, Europcar Croydon’s customer service advisor whether I can provide address proof now or whether there is anything we can do so I can pick up the car that I booked a long time ago, he was not willing to help in any way.
I am left with the cost and no car. Very disappointing. I will never book with Europcar again.

Having a car booked for 6 pm today, I received several confirmation e-mails, 3 only today, to get there and have the car rental denied was heartbreaking.
I rented with the company before and had no issues, all very smoothly. Also had rented another time and, with plenty of notice, had the reservation cancelled (which is fine), but having received several confirmation e-mails throughout the day to get there and having no explanation why I had no car waiting for me is less than human. I have lost my hotel reservation, deposit, and exhibition.
Worse is, I've gone around King's Cross to the other rental companies (including the same one, just a different branch), they all ran background checks, said it was all ok, but either had no cars or only £1k+/day cars.
There is no way of knowing whether you will get a car or not with Europcar, a company that is not very trustworthy.
What my trip was about shouldn't matter for the episode, but it's extra sad that it was a birthday present that got completely ruined, as there's no way of getting where we planned on going.

I have worked with Europcar representatives for over 27 years, I generally hire from other outlets but decided to go with them. Booked a Nissan Quashqai size vehicle in advanced and presumed it would be, My wife and I arrived at Peterborough Europcar premises, completed the paperwork and then was given a smaller Jeep Avenger. The young person, told me thats all he has got and gave us £10.00 off (big deal), the vehicle was dirty on the inside, damaged rear bumper, scuffed wheels to name a few. Had the vehicle from 25th June until 3rd July 2025.

My experience with Europcar has been extremely frustrating. I picked up the car at Edinburgh Airport, and the price we agreed on at the desk was not respected. I was charged significantly more than what was originally confirmed, including extra fees and taxes that were never mentioned in advance.
I’ve sent several emails to their customer service and haven’t received any reply at all. The lack of communication and support is unacceptable.
Overall, this experience has been really disappointing. I will definitely not use Europcar again, and I cannot recommend this company to anyone. There are other rental services that are at least transparent and reliable.

Two months ago I rent a car from Europe car, they charged me 150 Euros more than what we discussed...
The invoice is not available and even after contacting them I haven't received one...
Shame on them!!

Customer service was poor. The costs that I was quoted were not the costs that I ended up paying - airport tax and VAT was added (not provided at the time of the quote). I was upgraded to an electric car as was sold as being more affordable and was assured that the mileage remaining would take me to my destination - it did not and had to spend 2 hours recharging and would not be reimbursed when made a complaint. I would never use this company again!!

Said everything was fine when we took the car back. Which it was. Then sent an report which said damage and that we had signed - and we had not. Don't use them. If you do check and get a paper copy of any documents that say all ok. Europcar was a trusted car hire but now in the sub green motion league.

My flight was diverted to Toulouse, my booked hire car was in Carcassonne Obviously stressed, as any passenger would be in the circumstance, I arranged an alternative at Toulouse. The office there oversold and, because I was so stressed, I wasn't thinking at the time and I signed the contracted. Later, I realised that the excess insurance which I had been told was included was an added extra (cover I didn't need) and I also realised that I should have been offered a one-way hire for one day, rather than being given a cancellation of my week's hire at Carcassonne and a new hire one-way hire from Toulouse for the week at a cost of some €600 more.

No apology from Eurocar. Just a "tough luck, you signed". They'll not get that chance again from me, even if they're the cheapest option.

The worst customer service I have ever experienced (and I use a lot of rentals).
Save yourself the pain - don't book Europcar.
👉 Call customer service, choose option 1, get cut off. Every single time.
👉 Call customer service, choose option 7. Speak to someone, who can't help. They transfer you to option 1. Wait on hold for 20 minutes, despite being told your #1 in the queue. Get cut off. Every single time.
👉 Email customer service. Wait at least 30 hours for a reply. Reply asks you to call option 1. Every single time.
👉 It's two weeks into my rental, trying to solve a problem from Day 1 of the rental.... still waiting.

DO NOT RENT FROM EUROPCAR under any circumstances. Pay the extra $50 for SIXT or Budget.

I rented a car from Europcar Gatwick in February 2025. When making the booking I added full insurance through the booking agent Discover cars and the supplier being keddy (AKA Europcar).
At the desk the lady verbally said she could see I had insurance so all was good, I paid the deposit.
It wasn’t until I looked at the invoice at home and saw a charge for premium insurance which had been added on top of the full cover insurance I had already purchased online. The premium insurance added was for £274. I immediately phoned Europcar, they told me they couldn’t do anything til after the car had been returned. So I emailed them once I had returned the car and keys to the out of office box.
This was in February. I have formally complained 3? times now. And nothing. I left a review on Google and Europcar just sent me the link to complain, the same link I’ve used several times already with no response.
I’ve seen lots of other Google reviews where people have been in the same situation as me. They just seem like an absolute scam of a company. And then actually ignore you when you try and pull them up on it. AVOID EUROPCAR.

I book around 8 car hires a year for personal use. I decided given the loyalty program on offer I would pay slightly more to book all car rentals through europcar given the quality of their cars. Over a 18 month period I spent the equivalent of 1994 euros + local charges. This should have given me 2545 points. On taking out the loyalty scheme I was promised that all rentals in the last 2 years would count. In the last 2 months europcar have launched a new scheme and wiped all history of my points now starting afresh! I have formally complained and been told that I will receive no carry over of points. This is an absolute disgrace. I will not be booking anymore europcar in the future. All it would have taken was some common sense to credit me the old points in the new scheme

I had some problems with the car I was given. After several hours trying to get the issue resolved, I decided to make a formal complaint by phone. This was ignored. I made another two complaints in writing, also ignored. I then sent a notice before action so I can take them to small claims court. I had a response saying they'd investigate, but of course I heard nothing afterwards. I don't want to go to court, but I've given them plenty of opportunity to resolve my problems.

Absolutely appalling experience with Europcar Newtown branch. After reporting my car fault on Monday (window stuck fully down and eventually falling inside the door, leaving the car completely open to theft and rain), I was promised a courtesy car. They finally arranged one for Saturday at 11:30 am.

I waited around, but nobody ever showed up. I tried calling the branch repeatedly all week and again on Saturday—phone just rings out every time, no answer, no call back, nothing. In the end, no courtesy car and not even the basic courtesy of a phone call to say they wouldn’t come.

Truly shocking level of customer service. I’ve never experienced anything quite like it. The Newtown branch clearly can’t cope and really needs shutting down. Avoid at all costs!

Collecting from Stanstead Airport on Thursday 26 June.
Only two reception staff and about 10 people waiting to pick up cars.
Took over an hour to get the keys. Since every car had been pre booked the company knew exactly how busy they would be and yet made no effort to staff up.
It says exactly what the management think of their clients.
Also a new , lubricious rule that you have to peovide your incoming flight number (seriously) as well as your departing flight. Why could that possibly matter?

Despite successfully completing the online pre-checkin, I arrived at Bristol airport to be told that my address was not on their database and ‘computer says no’: I could not have a car. I gave two previous addresses but still ‘no’. I asked the desk clerk to phone her IT support team but ‘no - we can’t do that’. I asked to speak to the manager who was rude, surly and, after making no effort to resolve their issue with my booking or to provide me with a cancellation invoice to prove I had turned up, he dismissed me and returned to poking his computer. Email complaints to the customer service desk received fairly cursory, unhelpful replies. I never received an explanation- beyond ‘human error’ or any acceptance that their system was at fault. The desk staff have no ability to resolve issues. I luckily managed to get a car from SIXT at a similar price. NEVER BOOK WITH EUROPCAR - if something goes wrong, you are on your own.
Cost me £11 to call them about my booking and they were useless, I ended up cancelling after going round in circles.

Just awful. I just couldn't get the car picked up. I'm a motorbility customer and I kept getting sent from one department to the other as nobody would take responsibility for the pick up. No point in trying to phone them as they don't pick up and then just cut you off. Really, AVOID! AVOID!

as a disabled person my car broke down on monday rac contacted them to get me a hire car , herd nothing from them even motability opperations have not herd from them ,what a poor show no contact no care of customers,there contract with mobility is up soon im hoping thay dump them a very poor show for a hire company

Placed a premium booking on Tuesday to collect on Friday. When I arrived to pick up I was told there was a new policy implemented 12 hours ago and they cannot release the car to me unless I have a airplane ticket booked. This was not communicated at any point and now left without a car! Extremely dissatisfied would never recommend anyone hiring from this company.

They offered to book a regular car however said they would need to charge me the premium charge cost I already paid so nearly £400 for a car they hire normally for £30?? Complete madness.

WORST HIRE EXPERIENCE – NEVER AGAIN

Absolute shambles of a company. Took nearly £500 from me for a van hire, I returned it in perfect condition with a full tank (after spending £200 on fuel), signed off at the depot with no issues… and then out of nowhere, they try and slap me with a random charge for “extra mileage.”

Funny how this supposed charge wasn’t mentioned when I handed the van back. Not a word at the time, but suddenly they’ve got the confidence to send robotic emails quoting “terms and conditions” after the fact, like that justifies daylight robbery.

You’re a multimillion-pound company chasing people for £60 like desperate vultures. No integrity. No transparency. Just jobsworth tactics and automated nonsense.

Avoid Europcar unless you enjoy surprise charges, smug copy-paste replies, and having to argue over scraps after already paying through the nose. Total disgrace.

Europcar charged us £153.90 for carpet cleaning after our rental at Manchester Airport, despite no prior warning. We were referred to the terms and conditions as justification to this saction. They took the money from our credit card without resolving our objections. Beware and review the rental agreement thoroughly to avoid these unexpected charges. Needless to say none of our party will select Europcar again for our autorentals requirements

Booked and paid for the car before we arrived and taken extra insurance out.
Arrived to get my car sorry all I have is a fiat 500 , well paid for the next size up. Sorry no car only the fiat come back and swap tomorrow.can I get refund for the difference no. Come back swap tomorrow
Next after paying all the car and extra insurance you get hit with 700 pound bond?

so come back for the car I’ve paid for and booked sorry no car wtf is this company doing

Terrible Experience – Hidden Fees and Misleading Practices

I strongly advise against renting a car from Europcar. Our experience was extremely disappointing and felt intentionally misleading. Upon arrival, we were pressured into renting a larger car than we originally booked, with the agent quoting us a price that did not include VAT—a detail they conveniently failed to mention until after we agreed.

To make matters worse, we were charged an unexpected Station Fee that was never disclosed on the website or in our confirmation email. These hidden costs added up quickly and left us feeling scammed.

This kind of lack of transparency is unacceptable. We will not be using Europcar again and suggest others avoid them to save time, money, and frustration.

Terrible experience at Europcar Sheffield – misleading and time-wasting

I booked a car online through Europcar at an average daily rate of £15. When I arrived at the Sheffield branch to collect the vehicle, I was told that the car I reserved was not available. Instead, they offered a Tesla and demanded an extra £30 per day for the upgrade during my 9-day rental.

When I declined, they offered another vehicle for an additional £12 per day. Again, I refused, and they then claimed that no other vehicles were available and that I would need to wait 3–4 hours for a car to be returned.

I had taken time off work and planned everything around this rental. After insisting firmly, they eventually gave me a car they had on-site — clearly proving that vehicles were available all along.

This company is clearly trying to upsell and exploit customers instead of honoring bookings. I had many options when booking, and I deeply regret choosing Europcar. They wasted over an hour of my time and caused unnecessary stress.

If the agreed vehicle is not available, you are supposed to upgrade the customer at no extra cost — not try to profit from the situation. This is unacceptable.

Avoid Europcar, especially the Sheffield branch.
Van booked paid for and all details uploaded driving licence proof of address to be told I’m not eligible to drive 🤣🤣 what a joke

Greedy Con Artists
I specifically said I didn't want roadside assistance. When I received my invoice I saw that I had been charged for it. They prey on tired travellers that they presume they won't see again..............in my case they certainly won't

Very disappointed with the service from the Maidstone branch. A hire car was due to be delivered to my 76-year-old mother at 9:00 AM. At 9:20, we received a call saying it would be delayed by an hour. When we asked for clarity or if the time could be improved, we were met with hostility and completely unhelpful customer service.

We were given contradictory excuses—first that they couldn’t reach the driver, then that the driver hadn’t even arrived at the office (despite the drive itself taking an hour). None of it made sense, and it was clear the car was never going to arrive on time.

The most frustrating part was the lack of honesty and the rude attitude. Eventually, the car was cancelled without informing us—we only found out through our insurance.

Extremely poor communication, no accountability, and unnecessarily stressful—especially for an elderly customer. We would never choose to use this company again given the choice.

We rented a car for our holiday in lake Garda .
And what a an unsafe shit show it was .
Firstly they tried to charge us more for our insurance cover and more for the child seat that we had all ready paid for.
Then the Q5 that we had originally thought we was getting was a beat up old Citroen which didn’t barely have room for our 2 suit cases and the boot flung open on the motorway where the bags were crammed in and they had the cheek to try and charge us more insurance on this car and more for the child seat !
Then when we got the car this is the whopper the child seat that we had booked and paid for for our 2 and half year old they brought out a car seat for a rear facing new born baby. When we alerted the staff they brought out a booster seat for a 4 year old plus and before we could raise concerns the man literally ran off and we had to leave the car park due to other cars trying to leave and blocking up the car park.Them they said you agreed to pay the extra insurance which was flung on us at a busy desk with a queue of people in a foreign country!
So for our holiday for 8 days we had to drive with our daughter in a seat belt which is completely illegal and unsafe and restate the work unsafe !
Due to this we didn’t drive 80 % of the holiday which we had planned to .
And still when I rang up customer service about all this when home they just brushed off the safety of our child as we have no evidence of the car seat and there is nothing we could do…. Surely they had the 2 car seats in there depot so surely that would be evidence enough.
The fact that we paid money to Europacar pre booked our child seat and car and they didn’t have the safety equipment of the car seat to keep our child safe is outrageous.
And then to be told we can not do anything about this is a sneaky and unsafe way to do business.
I would like to see if I rented a car and child seat for one of their children and rush them out of the car park and see how they would feel.
I would never use Europacar ever again unsafe unprofessional and sneaky aswell in the end .
Take your money and provide an unsafe service disgusting.
Scums and dogs
Horrible, please be very careful! You agree on one price, but once you return a car, they charge you triple extra. I rent cars very often and have never experienced such treatment.

This company has a history of being fraudulent but i thought it was reputable....until i used them.
Similar to so many reviews i was inundated and pressured on arrival to upgrade every aspect of my booking.
I didn't as i had selected my chosen option prior to booking as 99% of us do so why annoy us so much on arrival.
The car had damage but was functional for the purpose of our trip.
We returned the car and left the keys in the cabin as there was no staff so we assumed that was it.
I complained about an invoice for £100 which i thought had been charged for alleged damage. I complained and said that i didn't and couldn't have caused the damage.....and that the damage shown would cost £5 to polish out.
It transpired that they wanted £450 for the alleged damaged and even referred me to a debt collector so i then owed over £500.
I eventually paid but intend to take legal action independently and will no doubt gain support once up and running.
Avoid at all costs this company will defraud you however way they can. Their business model is to sell low but looks to upsale or defraud.
It is an absolute scam and i cannot believe they are still in business.

I strongly urge others not to use Europcar. My experience was nothing short of a rip-off. After returning a rental vehicle in good condition and signing what I believed was a routine check-in form, I was later hit with a staggering £714 charge for a tiny scratch.

There was no transparency about how this figure was calculated, no prior notification before the charge was applied, and no opportunity for a fair dispute. I formally raised concerns with customer service (Case #23359929), but the response was robotic and dismissive – no explanation, no breakdown of costs, and no engagement with the clear disparity between the "damage" and the fee.

The process feels deliberately opaque, and the customer support offered no real dialogue or justification for such an extortionate charge.

Warning to all renters:

Do not sign anything when returning the vehicle unless damage is properly reviewed with you on-site.

Document everything with photos.

Be aware Europcar may charge you excessively and without transparency.

This kind of behavior from a major rental company is unacceptable and exploitative. I am sharing my experience to prevent others from going through the same.

Absolute joke of a company, tried to book a car over a month ago, Europcar cancelled on their end and said I’d get my refund within 10 days as it was cancelled by them, still 4 weeks later no refund and all I’m getting from them is “ it’s been sent for approval because it was a non refundable booking”

This was my first time hiring a car, and I am so frustrated with my experience with them. They gave me a car that had a screw in the tyre. Without going into all the details here, they basically accused me of lying. I wrote many emails of complaint but they still charged me £195 for a tyre. I had taken insurance with a different company because it was cheaper but honestly I have never known any company to have such little regard towards their customers. From start to finish with company, I would go as far to say that they are the worst company of any company I have ever experienced.
The dashboard said there was a low tyre as I was leaving the depot, so I had a quick look and judged that none looked low to the eye, and just thought I’d keep an eye on it and pump it up myself to get it to the correct level. According to them, I should have checked all the tyres for screws and nails before leaving. Are you serious? I drove home and left it on the drive over night. In the morning it was nearly completely flat. I drove to a petrol station to pump it up noticed a screw in the tyre. I called them and was told to take it back to the depot. I did this, and I was told to take to Kwik Fit. I was also told it would be free as it wasn’t my fault. The apparently have no recollection of this. Their customer service have been terribly rude, and condescending, and any emails I have sent have not been personable in any way. No apology for my bad experience due to their incompetencies.

Booked a car with europcar at Edinburgh airport on arrival they took my license & then advised I could not hire a car off them , couldn’t advise me to why I had been declined ,the booking was carried out as usual on the europcar app, I had booked several bookings this year & last year through the app , I found this quite astounding that they could decline with no reason , I called the DVLA Swansea & checked with them if anything was on my license that would decline this & the answer was none, I then noticed then that my middle name was missing a letter & I think this could be the only issue that could show up which is quite petty
Will never use europcar again & all the rest of our colleagues will be told the same
And to take this to an insult they tried taking £102 from my bank today
There were many Events on at the time & I believe they off loaded me to facilitate over bookings that they had booked
I am now awaiting for a response from europcar in this matter before I take legal proceedings to recover the costs that it cost me to take out another hire from another company which was an excessive charge

I went to Europcar at Stansted on Sunday 22/06/2025 @ 19:30. I made the booking directly on Europcar website and I made the full payment ahead of the collection.

The person at the counter said my booking was rejected due to "policy reviews" preventing them from renting to locals. That was the only explanation and he didn't provide any alternative. This was a booking for a company for a professional meeting.

This is the worst experience ever. I completely advise against using EuropCar and I will never use it again.

Terrible experience picking up a Fiat500 from Heathrow Airport. Car had no working radio and no air conditioning. See pic of roof aerial snapped off taken from LHR car park before hire started. Standard reply below. I complained at drop off verbally, during rental, reviewed in the link Europcar sent and to my broker. 2 weeks later zero response. AVOID! What joke of a car hire company rent cars with no aircon? This is how Europcar treats loyal Privilege members. Reservation 157679920. You have all the info you need. I went through the website but Europcar’s response was “hard luck”. Please delete my Privilege account.

The staff here are friendly and helpful. The car requested was available, clean, and fit for purpose. The one star relates to administration and customer services. In a nutshell, they are claiming that I never paid a deposit so won't get the £250 that I did pay back. I paid a deposit and I can prove that; after all, who can hire a car without having to pay a deposit? What worries me is the stress and hassle for me in getting it back, and the convenience for and monetary interest earned by them. It's quite simply wrong.
EDIT : As of 9 July and following more emails from me STILL NOTHING! Small claims court, here I come.

No car was available at the appointed time and place, although the booking was made four days in advance, and no explanation was given - just ‘all the cars are out’. It is standard industry practice to provide an upgraded alternative if the class of car ordered is not available and this was not done. As a result I was left having to pay for an expensive taxi. No compensation was offered. An unacceptably poor service!!

I was surprised to find so many negative reviews for Europcar as until recently I had used them several times and thought their service was good.
Sadly my last experience has shown me what their are really like. I inadvertently drove into an area in London that is no longer accessible to non-residents, unless you’re a guest. No longer living in London I didn’t know this and received a penalty notice.
I was surprised to receive it from Europcar week after my car was returned, but on realising it was my mistake I paid the notice and informed Europcar it had been settled. My complaint was that having paid the £65 fine promptly and thinking that was the end of the matter. Europcar then deducted another £45!! from my credit card to pay for their admin. I wrote to their customer services dept in case it was a mistake, as all they had to do was look up who was driving the car in question and send on an email informing them of the fine.
It would taken them 5-10 mins of their time to carry this out and for that they thought it was fair to charge £45 - which works out at an hourly rate of around £250-300p.h.
When I pointed this out the customer services department were obstructive and extremely rude, repeating the same comment that’s it’s in the t&c’s I had signed on hiring the car.
I tried to appeal against their argument but I kept receiving replies from the same 2 people who wouldn’t even listen to my point.
I understand that they need to make a charge for admin but £45 - on top of a £65 penalty notice is really extreme.
But it’s their poor customer service and the way my complaint was dealt with …or should I say ignored, that means they have lost yet another previously loyal customer. I need to hire a car every 4-6 weeks so they have lost my custom along with a lot of other people from what I am now reading.
Such a shame they are so short-sighted. Maybe the chiefs don’t know what the Indians are doing but if not then they deserve the criticism for not following the reviews on here.

We rented a car in Faro over three months ago and were required to pay a €300 deposit, which we promptly provided. When returning the vehicle at Europcar Praia da Rocha (Portimão), the company attempted to charge us an additional €167 for "an extra day," despite returning the car on the agreed date. We were informed that our deposit would be refunded within 10 days. However, after this period elapsed, the deposit had not been received.

We contacted customer service, but their responses were unhelpful; representatives repeatedly disconnected our calls and were unable to provide clear information. Eventually, we were advised that the refund would take up to 28 days due to international processing times. Despite this, the deposit has still not been credited back to our account.

We have since liaised extensively with our bank and Europcar, but the issue remains unresolved. Customer service has been unhelpful throughout, and the situation is currently under investigation. We advise others to exercise caution when dealing with this company.
Worst company to rent a car with took payment and no refund issued when they cancelled booking. So rude on the phone and unhelpful.

Booked a car on website, received booking confirmation which was more than confusing in "you need to bring" section, phoned number provided to clarify "if applicable - an official translation of your driving licence and/or International Driving Permit." Operator said it was not required as his Dad did not need it once when abroad. Started to challenge as not professional advice and then my phone cut off, luckily as I had set a Spend cap. Upon investigation realised the number provided 08713841087 was a premium rate number. Avoid Europcar as that call cost me £5, most of the time was ina queue to be answered!

They scammed us twice, took our money and then called 2 days later to cancel. The second time they cancelled was a day before we were due to move house! Absolutely despicable company, do not book here!!!!

Then worst hire company i have ever known, They took the money (later to find out it was through their philippines) office who have no idea about what they have in stock, took the money then the next morning canceled the booking and keeping the money for 10 working days. This is FRAUD they are miss selling their product to customers and earning interest through miss gained money. absolute scammers !!!!
Rubbish company cancelled my reservation on last day, didn’t pass credit checks. Why don’t do check before booking, and refund will be after week. Don’t suggest if you plan something ahead

Utterly shocking. Paid upfront for car hire, then paid for a taxi to go pick it up. Arrived … only to find that they “didn’t have a car after all”. (No car for hire at all, not just the car I had paid for). They are unable to give an immediate refund, for payment which was instantly taken for a service they cannot provide. Hundreds of pounds. It “might” take 10 days to receive a refund, could be longer, no one knows. Phone lines are not answered. In the meantime how can a person then afford to go hire another car? Made enquiries at their other office in the city, before realising they were not about to refund me, and they offered the same car type for twice the price. Walked the miles to the other depot, to find a damaged car which they would have been unable to hire to me anyway as the damage was so bad. Awful. Am needing to seek legal counsel to recoup money. I never write reviews, but this needs to be noted. This is the Stoke on Trent branches.

EuropCar
6040924162 / Res: 1186729643) - Case #22966365
Lodged a complaint about letting out a dangerous 9 seater Mercedes vehicle to us.
Did not apologise, refused to refund and still continue renting the vehicle out thus putting customers life at risk. When to get to Spain don't hire from Europcar. Their only priority is to make money out of you without any consideration being given to your safety
They have substandard customer service skills towards clients. Avoid this organisation particularly if you're a Motability customer

This is to many starts. This is the worst hire car company I have ever used. They bought wrong 2 hrs late and then weren't helpful. Next day phoned to arrange a delivery of correct car. I was on the phone for 3 hrs trying to phone back.
Pick up is just a message assuming I will be in, then didn't turn up. I told them they can have an hrs window, they told me to leave the keys out side under a plant pot.

I booked a car with Europcar UK and successfully applied a discount coupon — I even have a screenshot showing the discount clearly applied and reflected in the final booking price.

Shockingly, upon returning the vehicle, the discount was quietly deducted from my deposit with no warning, no explanation, and in complete contradiction to what was shown at checkout.

I reached out to customer service with full evidence (including a timestamped screenshot), only to be told “no coupon was applied” — a flat denial despite clear proof. Since then, I’ve sent follow-up emails and received no response whatsoever.

As a customer recently made redundant, I find this treatment not only financially unjust, but in breach of basic consumer rights.

I am now escalating the matter to Trading Standards, the Financial Ombudsman, and leaving this review to warn others.

It’s outrageous for a large company to behave in such a dismissive and unethical manner. If you apply a discount with Europcar, they will just remove it. Avoid at all costs this company!!

Worst serviceb I have ever experienced.
From call center to pick rental collection absolutely disgusting. Rate extremely poor below acceptable standard.

Great at dropping the car off.
Have spent a day wasted waiting for them to collect - despite having a text message at 09:30 to say they were on their way way.
Spent hours waiting on the phone - only for them not to answer.
Got a phone call at 15:23 to say they were nearly here and then a text message at 16:01 to say they were on their way 🤷‍♂️
Nothing but hassle

On picking up my car it had 2 minor scrathes on a plastic wheel trim. On returning the car they have charged me £240 for 2 alloy wheel repairs. Their own charges schedule says that a broken or damaged wheel trim is £45, and the exact trim is £30 from Citroen. The guy tried to stop me taking of the wheel trim and taking a photo of it. I have submitted said photo and demanded a refund but they do not get back to me. On top of this he said that if I didn't sign his device I would lose my £500 blocked deposit.

Since the beginning of the rental, I have faced several problems with the vehicle. After going to the city of Porto (about half-an-hour from the airport) and parking the car, I realized that the doors did not lock with the remote control and that the car would not start. I contacted their helpline and was told that the vehicle would be towed and a taxi would be sent to take me to another Europcar counter.

About an hour later, I arrived at the counter on Rua Gonçalo Cristóvão, where I had to wait another hour to be served due to the high number of people. I requested priority service, since the problem was Europcar's responsibility, but I was treated with indifference and a lack of professionalism by an employee, whose response was that I would have to wait the necessary time and that it was not her who caused the problem. I consider this attitude unacceptable and completely disrespectful.

After finally delivering a second car to me, I continued on my journey. However, when I arrived at my destination, I realized, to my surprise, that the remote control of this new car did not lock the doors either. I was again forced to return to the same counter, where, after another wait, I was provided with a third car, without any apology.

Since I picked up the first vehicle at 8:30 am, I spent about four hours without access to a working car, which means that I spent that time without enjoying the service I had already paid for. This lost time compromised important commitments that I had scheduled, namely a trip to the Citizens' Shop, which caused even more delays and inconvenience in the following days. All of this was made worse by the fact that I had been awake since 2am, having arrived in Porto at 7:30am on a flight.

I have filed a claim 4 weeks ago and have received no reply yet. Very unprofessional

I wish to provide a candid warning to those contemplating the prospect of hiring from this company, particularly with regard to their Heathrow branch. This caution is underscored by a significant volume of negative reviews available online, and my experience is not isolated.

During my interaction with the Heathrow location, I was subjected to charges exceeding £200, categorised as a Premium Station surcharge. This fee is levied despite the availability of other provincial alternatives within a reasonable taxi or cab fare of approximately £20. Furthermore, I was charged for Super Premium Personal Accident Cover, which is redundant as I possess my own comprehensive annual coverage with premiums totalling less than the cost of their two-week charge. Additionally, their breakdown cover was almost twice the cost of a standard RAC or AA annual policy for annual duration.

Regrettably, I discovered these exorbitant charges only upon receipt of my invoice, as none of these fees were disclosed to me in advance. I strongly advise prospective customers to explore numerous online options for car hire excess cover provided by various insurers, which are available at a fraction of the costs imposed by this company. It is prudent to exercise caution; these charges are often hidden until after the transaction.

My attempts to rectify the situation were met with a lack of accountability. I engaged with a representative named Monica at a Spanish call centre, who assured me that the matter would be investigated. However, after a five-day interval, I was informed that no action had been taken, and I was told that Monica would face internal disciplinary measures.

Although a decision was made to refund my charges, I was subsequently informed that the process would take five days due to the sum exceeding their operational limits, necessitating approval from the UK. This was further compounded by a call handler abruptly ending our conversation when I sought clarification, stating that they were restricted in the length of calls. Once approval was secured, I was told that an additional ten days would be required for the funds to reach my account.

This level of indifference displayed by their representatives is striking, particularly in light of how they would likely respond if the roles were reversed and they were in a similar predicament. My experience has been distressing, exacerbating my PTSD with multiple triggers stemming from their deceptive practices.

I encourage anyone who has previously rented from this company to reassess their charges. Even years later, with the appropriate documentation, claims may be pursued in the County Court. To summarise:

1. Avoid utilising the Heathrow location.
2. Scrutinise all charges, regardless of the duration of your rental.
3. Research supplementary services available from various providers online.
4. Review competitor options thoroughly, paying particular attention to customer feedback.

Protect yourself and make informed decisions.
Worst company…Let me down 2 days,promise to deliver my car,keep me at home to wait and never delivered.Even no phone call from the company!I will take another step to send my complain!

Hire car through RAC car has issues tyre valves are faulty and they don't care no response from customer service byd car given with no charge in car no dust caps which has caused issue with valves . europcar customer service is a joke no help from them

I thought I was booking car from train station as that is what I searched for, but booked the airport instead of train station in Lille as It added in nearby places and called itself Europe Lille. Europcar refused to amend booking, despite I called Expedia within 20 mins of booking - soon as I noticed what had happened. Said I have to cancel and pay the cancelation charge and book again! Will never use them again. Expedia stepped in to compensate me - which was good of them.

We rented a car from Europcar Manchester via Expedia. As older French customers with limited English, we signed the rental agreement believing we were simply confirming the vehicle pick-up.

However, Europcar added extra paid services (premium insurance and roadside assistance) without clearly explaining them, even though we had already purchased full insurance coverage via Expedia.

Despite our complaints, Europcar refused any refund, relying solely on our signature and ignoring the language barrier and the context in which it was signed.

This was a very disappointing experience and, in our view, a clear abuse of vulnerability. We strongly advise non-English speakers or older travellers to avoid Europcar unless all documents are clearly translated and explained.

We booked a van 9 days before we required it. The day before we asked if we could pick it up the night before, they agreed and changed the booking.

An hour later they called us to say it shouldn’t have been amended as they were going to call us to tell us no vans were available and they knew that but just hadn’t put the call in yet. (we’re helping our son move house 200 miles away.)

So let’s see if the refunds appear on our card,

Rubbish service and we won’t be using again.

literally and quite frankly the worst experience of my life. customer service is very rude, they become really defensive and dont actually try to help you. if you're in the uk use avis or something else instead i swear this was a total clown show

Diabolical service - Lincoln branch, terrible service!
Booked a car with Europcar a few days ago to travel to Wales for a funeral. Paid for it online, did the online check in with licence etc all accepted and they took the money. Paid on a credit card.
Went to pick up the car they said I couldn’t have it as I failed the credit check. 1. They couldn’t have called to say you can’t have the car before going to pick it up several days after it was booked to give me an opportunity to sort it out. 2. Why do they not do a credit check before accepting your booking and taking your payment. 3. They do not highlight that they do a credit check or get you to tick a box to give permission for the credit check. Had they done this, we could have booked under my wife as I had an issue with being scammed and a fraud identity which is still impacting credit score.
They left me stranded unable to get to a family funeral which could have been completely avoided.
Obviously do not care about customers at all! Also they still have my money and I am yet to see my £150 returned!

What a Terrible fraudulent company. I was Given a hired car due to a bus company Damaging my car. When I picked up the corsa if had unbelievable amount of scratches fir a car of say less than a year old body work and wheels totally damaged. Within the hour I Rang the company about all the Damage on the car which was not Discribed on my invoice document the said take pictures of the Damage ( luckily I did plus video footage). When I returned the car I also took more videos and pictures of the car just to be safe. Anyway 2 abd a half weeks later I received and email from a second party company representative if Europe car, They said I gave Damaged the car abd the are assessing the cost and would charge me, I was shocked as I emailed them saying I Reported the Damage that was nothing to do with me. After many phone calls and emails and me sending many mire video and pictures of the Damage they finally admitted the damage was nothing to do with me, To this Day I am still waiting for a Reply that why did it take them 2 and a half weeks to claim damages from me and also with a car with so much scratches why didn't they repair the car before the hire it out to the next customer.

Booked a car - I had to change the card that I booked with from Amex to Mastercard as they wouldn't take the Amex card at the desk to pay, then I got an email canceling my booking charging me £45 fee to cancel and then charged a further £100 for the new hire of the rental. Not once did I cancel the booking simply change the payment method, so they can't take the payment at the desk but have authority to take it off my card anyway. Still waiting on a refund of the cancellation fee - Customer services are useless.

Never use this hire car company, they are nothing short of scrap. This is now the second time they have shafted me as a business customer using their services. I drove over the Dartford bridge and payed the fee within the time allocated for paying the fee. Europcar are now insisting I haven't paid the toll and have now helped themselves to £45 off my credit card. What business does that? Certainly not a properly run company that is for sure. Avoid at all costs and choose ANY other car hire company. These people are scammers!

Although having received a reply from Eurocar via Trustpilot .
It invited me to liaise further on the matter, only to find out that they take no over the phone calls but to E/M them instead.
This only drew a blank, and insisted on payment with a take it or leave it attitude .
Paid up now to settle the issue but I give customer service a Zero rating.

Avoid at all costs. I’ve used many car hire companies, and Europcar is a level below all the others. They gave me a dirty, unsafe baby seat that wouldn’t buckle, forcing me to go into Naples and buy a new one for €150 — which they refuse to refund. They told me a €100 deposit was included in the charges at the desk for pick-up, which I have not got back and had to raise a formal credit card dispute. They also gave wrong instructions to pick up the car, causing unwelcome delays with a baby. The staff were rude and dismissive and Europcar have closed my complaint even after I provided full details. Truly awful experience.

Wish their was a minus rating and consequences for europ car

Horrible company horrible service

In the space of 7 days over 40 calls to Bradford Leeds branch no answer they put u on hold once connected and phone dies no immediate response no help if an emergency nothing
Gave me a wrong car and I suffered due to it due to it being small and me not be able to breath right due to health felt really costrophobic and edgy and told europcar but still no response for 4 days

Never would refer europcar and never using again

My entire experience with Europcar has been nothing short of shocking and deeply disappointing. Upon arriving at the rental desk, I was told that my reservation was "blocked" without any clear explanation, despite having a confirmed booking through Carflexi. I was then told I had no choice but to pay double the original price (for a new contract) for a different vehicle on the spot. Feeling pressured and stranded, I had no other choice than to comply.

What followed was a series of deceitful and contradictory actions that made it clear this was not an isolated incident, but rather what felt like a systematic scam.

The agent handling my rental, someone named Sheikh, presented a false "upgrade" that I had never agreed to, and I was misled about what I was actually being charged for. It later turned out that I had been mistakenly identified as someone else with the same name, which Europcar themselves admitted in writing, confirming the error was entirely on their side.

However, when I requested a refund for the extra charges caused by their own mistake, Europcar refused to accept any further responsibility. They effectively cut off communication and showed no willingness to resolve the issue, leaving me with no option but to escalate the case to the European Car Rental Conciliation Service (ECRCS).

To make matters worse, days after ECRCS confirmed I would be refunded £157 for the unjustified upgrade fee, Europcar attempted to charge my card an additional £142 without my consent. The only reason this unauthorized charge failed was because I had already transferred all remaining funds from that account, leaving no balance for them to take. I then had to urgently contact my bank and request the card be frozen to prevent any further attempts. This added yet more stress and time to an already exhausting situation.

I have never in my life encountered a company that operates with such blatant disregard for honesty, accountability, and customer trust. I strongly urge others to avoid Europcar, especially at this location (London, Heathrow), unless you are prepared to be deceived, overcharged, and ignored when things go wrong.

Gatwick South Terminal Staff asked to have my credit card on file despite having paid for the car hire and insurance in advance. I told them I didn't need any insurance cover as I'd already purchased this. They assured me that I would not be charged for insurance or other charges and this was just a formality. I signed their document only after being reassured by their staff member that my credit card would not be debited. On returning the car, by credit card was debited nearly 500 GBP for 'Premium Protection' cover. They refuse to refund or investigate the actions of their staff member.

i have waited on a car getting returned between 1 and 3 o’clock nearly hour nhslf after stated time still waiting 4 calls to there office and not any further forward absolutely rubbish customer experience no help whatsoever sitting in all day cancelled a appointment as waiting on them uplifting car not a great way to treat your customers Europcar

Booked a car only to be refused when I arrived because apparently my address couldnt be verified by their system!! I've lived here for 25 years!

They tried to get me to put my wife on the agreement at the cost of an extra £100. They knew I needed a car and that I'd made the journey there, so hoped I'd just do it.

Such a transparent tactic to make money.

I used Enterprise.

I know they are more expensive, but save yourself the pain and avoid these clowns.

Booked a compact elite car, when I arrived to pick up the attendant at the desk was using fear mongering to get me to pay for extra protection cover which costed more than the total rental of the car. He told me that even if someone else scratches or hits my car I will have to pay a massive sum of money as excess. In the past I haven’t added this cover and had no issues but this time the attendant was being really pushy and made me feel so uncomfortable that I added it anyway. He made very clear to me the only charges that will come out my account is the extra protection charge, the deposit, and the toll payer. I double checked with him because I already felt very ripped off paying over double what I booked the car at and he reassured me that was all the costs- nothing else would be taken from me. After I gave my car back I got an invoice with 2 extra charges that made the total 3 TIMES what I initially agreed on. My card was already set up from when I collected so they took the money. I emailed them a whole month ago and they refuse to get back to me to explain why I was lied to about costs. DO NOT book with them, you will see a price online - multiply that be THREE if you want the actual cost of hiring it. Customer service doesn’t even exist so you won’t be helped after the fact either. Appalling company and I’ll never book with them again. Some of the cheaper companies are actually a lot better..

Hired a car with them, via Jetcar, turned up, they put my info into the system and told me they couldn't give me a car.

Still waiting for a refund.

For context I then walked to Enterprise, an hour and a half away who sorted me out with a car within 10 minutes despite me not having a booking.

AWFUL AND RUDE CUSTOMER SERVICE
These morons added numerous additional charges and charged my card without confirming or providing any evidence.
They claimed I drove into Europe or the Republic of Ireland, something I absolutely did not do. They refuse to listen to me and instead ignore those parts of the emails.
SAMUEL at customer service is an absolute idiot who uses AI to respond to emails. He can't even respond properly and doesn't acknowledge half of what you say.

DO NOT BOOK WITH EUROPCAR! They will charge you for things you did not do, they won't provide any evidence for it, and they have TERRIBLE customer service. The company should be ashamed.

I obviously will never book with Europcar again, and nobody else should either. Ignore this clown company.
I have sent them 3 emails over the course of 2 weeks and they have all been ignored. Absolutely horrendous company with atrocious customer service. Avoid

Second bad review from me. I missed a flight due to airport IT FAILIRE problems. I rang to inform europecar very very early on within a few hours of the airport IT FAILIRE to tell them and that I could not pick up for 2 more days they said thanks for being so quick and helpful and that I would not be charged again ...but when I picked the car up they charged me again making up some very poor excuse because I booked with Ryanair.I have used them maybe 5 times and twice they have double charged me -the previous time I was with my very unwell Father....not nice at all and completely unfair in all the circumstances.

I wrote a review back in March about the terrible service I am receiving with regards to damage to a car I rented last July. Well things just got worse. I am continuing to email them regularly, but have now reached a point where everyone has closed the case, Europcar, their lawyers, the third party insurers, but no one has paid me back my money! And in case Europcar comment saying please contact customer services, I have! At least 20 times. I will seriously be avoiding this company, and good luck anyone who's car is damaged, even if it's not your fault. Looks like they keep your money!

Europcar are a disgrace don't use them.

They impose a ridiculously high accident excess of £1600 because they know this will then force the customer to take out the equally over priced extra charges for accident protection which is pretty much the same cost as the hire itself.

This £1600 is disgraceful, Europcar are basically extorting money from customers and they know it. Use Enterprise/AVIS anyone but this awful company.

Don’t use this company. The Europcar Newcastle Airport still haven’t returned my deposit to me and I returned the car in May 12th. Their customer service has hung up on me several times when I’ve called them about this. I’ve now lodged a complaint with the BVRLA. Warning to anyone thinking of use them - DONT.

Absolute thievery. I paid for the vehicle on line on the proviso that I would pay a holding fee of £500 on collection to be released on return of the vehicle. The woman at the desk would not let us pay the holding fee via credit card, claiming that it wasn't working (It was working perfectly and is still working perfectly now) She then would not allow us to pay via phone using the credit card on the banking app. She claimed it was a problem with our card/bank It wasn't. She refused to let us try paying on a different terminal and put us in the position where we were forced to pay a non-refundable fee of £208 on debit card or cancel the hire losing the deposit in the process. We had two young children with us and a long journey to undertake so we had to pay. Unless this is resolved I will not ever use Europcar again and will encourage anyone and everyone that will listen that Europcar encourages immoral methods of obtaining payment. A total disgrace

I was told the car was full of fuel and to return it full. But when I got in it, it was only half full.
No problem I thought, I'll take a picture of the dashboard and get on with my journey or else I'd be late for my meeting. Just to be sure though, I phoned the customer service line when I was free a few hours later to report the half full tank. They said they'd log the issue and could I please email in my picture of the dashboard, which I did.

I topped up the tank back to the half full level with 20 litres petrol before returning the car 2 days later having driven 221 miles (petrol hybrid). I mentioned to the agent on return about the fuel issue and naively thought that would be it sorted.

How wrong could I be - having been charged to refuel back to a full tank, I got in touch to remind Europcar about all the efforts I'd gone to inform them that I received the car half full. They have subsequently accused me of lying about this! Their attitude to customer service is just unbelievable...I've hired plenty times over the years, all of which they have on record, yet they assume that out of nowhere after being an honest customer for years, I suddenly want to get £50 fuel from them? I've sent pictures of the dashboard at time of pick-up and return that are time-stamped, clearly proving that I am right. I've sent a picture of the receipt showing I filled up with 20litres fuel - an ideal volume to have travelled 221 miles in a hybrid car! What more evidence do they need. They've lost me as a customer for life now because they've accused me of dishonesty. There are plenty of other hire companies I can choose from instead.

Booked hire card for Faro in plenty of time and added the maximum cover I could while in the UK. Upon arrival I was intimidated to take extra cover which was more than what I had paid already for the hire car and adequate insurance, travelling is stressful and you just want to get on with your holiday and Europcar take full advantage.

I would give no stars if possible, my partner hired a van. Handed it back on the 3rd May. They have now invoiced him for damages , claiming a key missing which happened on the 29th May.
