We’ll see if it is collected or not and if it isn’t I swear I’m going to go absolutely nuts!!!
I would rate 0 if I could and would highly recommend not using Europcar.
Interestingly I’m clearly not on my own.

We hired a car from Bristol Airport. We have been charged an extra £86.28 at the end of the hire & no idea what for. Emailed the company to be told it was a verbal agreement with the staff member who dealt with us. There was no verbal agreement & no other service was sold to me. I was asked if I had the correct insurance which I had as I had purchased the premium insurance & the guy behind the desk was not happy I was not spending more money.
He then said that £186 had to be held on my credit card & it would be refunded. This was a lie & he has kept £86.28!!
I have emailed advising this is fraud & theft! Waiting on a response.
Do not use Europcar the are fraudulently taking money from people!!! Dreadful customer service

Reading the reviews on here I realise I have experienced ALL of the same problems as other customers over a period of time whilst using Europcar on a regular basis.

I was accussed of tyre damage 6days after returning a vehicle, I challenged them asking for eveidence, the case was closed and I never received any eveidence.

I was then unknowingly charged for the additional Insurance, actially adding a further £884 to my hire, I challenged them again requesting for the CCTV from when I collected the car as I wished it to be viewed in the hope a lip reader could translate my conversation with the member of staff that dealt with the hire. The case was found in my favour & the case was closed.

A car I had on hire was parked outside my house, unfortunately another drived crashed into the hired car 🙄 I was assured by Europcar that the car would be collected & a replacement would be delivered, 2 days later still no replacement car, so I hired from another company as needed a vehicle for work purposes, Europcar had already lost me 2 days income 🙄
Several days later Europcar took a further payment from my account! Which then raised my hire by ££££'s! I have emailed & called then raising concern and asking for an explanation, to date I have received a email response advising "Once they obtain the relevant information they will be intouch" I sent them screen shots of everything with my initial email 🙃 The email they email me from you can't reply to 🤔
Several weeks later I have called them 3 times, each time being told they will contact a diffrent department as they can't help 🤪
My latest email May 30th asking Europcar for an update has received no reply 🥴

Oh yes! I was also accused of damaging a panel on one of their hired cars to! Luckily for me I took a video of all the vehicle inside & out before I left the hire depot, the case was closed. There is never any previous damage maked on the paperwork they give you on hiring a car, Please be wise and take a video 👍

Do I have to take them to the small claims court? 🙂

I swear NEVER Again!

Several weeks later, I

From start to finish dreadful. Courtesy/hire car was arranged through AA insurance following our car being involved in an accident.
Europcar sent me a supposedly secure link so that my payment card for the £1 deposit was logged. About 4 hours later I received a telephone call from a private number with the caller saying he was from Fraud Prevention. I was asked if I had used my card within the last half hour, which I hadn't and was then asked if I had made a payment of £1 to Europcar earlier. I was told that a payment of £2000+ had been made using my card and that it would seem it had been cloned. My money would be refunded and a new card issued but I needed to give more digits from my card. I realised this was a scam so hung up and contacted my bank. They were very concerned about the caller knowing about Europcar and asked me to contact Europcar which I did. I was assured that this matter would be investigated by their Fraud Department and that I would be kept informed - I haven't.
As far as the courtesy car is concerned it was delivered and collected a day late with little communication.
Appalling.

Absolutely disgusting service. I just spent 1 1/2 being placed on hold by 3 of their employees at the motability rental. They were rude. They didn’t know how to help me so fobbed me off by placing me on hold or either cutting me off. I’ve never ever had such bad service. It frustrated me so much i ended up having to take tablets for goodness sake.
After this experience I would suggest that Europcar Uk need to train their employees. Anybody could do the service they provide!! Crazy experience
And all I wanted was to find out where the rental car was that an employee there, yesterday PROMISED me that it would be delivered today. Obviously I guess it’s not coming today.

It’s left me so stressed out and wasted so much time when it could have taken only 1 employee that actually knew their job to tell me what is happening.

Cancelled booking within 2 hours of me making it but withholding the full amount £1500 for 8-10 days before returning to my account. An absolute disgrace and after many years of booking with Europe that is my last! A pure money making manoeuvre

Absolutely disgusting service.
I booked a car when I arrived to collect the car the customer service person was serving a customer and was upgrading the customer without consent with an additional charge.
I went to the counter and he tried the exact thing with me. I told him No and he still continued to upgrade my booking telling me it would only cost £200 for the upgrade. I got upset with this and told him I wanted the car I booked and he was very reluctant to give me the keys and accused me of being aggressive. I will never use this car hire service again.

Terrible customer service after not being given the car that I booked through this website. I pre-paid and now I'm out of pocket £250 having spent 120 EUR to and from the airport. Heraklion airport let go of my reservation after not showing up for 2hrs per their T&C's but the UK office when I called assured me the car would be help after my arrival. I have called muliple times their customer service number and was hung up once, the others put on hold for an extended amount of time only to be told my case was closed and tough luck I'm out of pocket with no refund issued. DO NOT BOOK WITH THEM, it's a SCAM.

Poor… disgusting service from start and ongoing!
Dirty cigarette smell and butts in the car, unsuitable and I’m a disabled customer.
No one to ever answer the phone at customer services and when they do they do nothing.. throughly unhappy with service.. wouldn’t go back if I didn’t need my mobility needs met!

Abysmal customer service experience.
Misled in to purchasing additional insurance that I didn't need - ended up costing more than the cost of the car hire. I noticed this an hour after taking the car out and got in contact to cancel to which they said to wait until the end of my hire. I waited until the end of my hire and now they are refusing cancellation of policy.
Additionally had car issues which I tried to sort over the phone. Continuously passed around department with no ownership being taken. Europcar employee told me to drive car (which wasn't working correctly or safely) to nearest branch (over a 2 hour round trip) or they couldn't help.

If I could have given less stars I would have, this "company" canceled my booking a day before I need the car leaving me in a right pickle! Now they're refusing to refund my money saying that they have no record of taking the money from my bank so now I have to prove to them that they have my money!!!!! Then wait to see if I'll ever get it back! Do not use this scam company!!!!

Please take heed — I would strongly advise avoiding this car hire company. We booked our rental through Auto Europe, unaware at the time that they act as a broker and that the actual rental would be fulfilled by Europcar. Had we known this in advance and read the reviews, we would never have gone ahead with the booking.

Upon arriving at Verona Airport, we eventually located the Europcar desk, and that’s when everything began to go wrong. The staff member at the desk was very insistent that we purchase additional insurance, despite the fact that we had already bought full protection through Auto Europe. Even after I phoned Auto Europe and they confirmed we were fully covered, the staff member continued to push the insurance, making us feel pressured and uncomfortable.

When we were finally given the keys, we discovered that the car provided was completely different from what we had booked. We had reserved a VW Tiguan or similar SUV specifically to fit our passengers and luggage, but were given a saloon instead. I returned to the desk, where I was told that SUVs and saloons fall into the same category. I contacted Auto Europe again, and after speaking with the Europcar desk staff, they informed me that nothing could be done as Europcar uses a different classification system than Auto Europe.

Eventually, a more suitable car was located, but we were told we’d have to wait 30 minutes while it was cleaned. In reality, we waited far longer — not an ideal start to a long-awaited holiday.

The car we were eventually given wasn't in the greatest condition, but at least it could accommodate both our group and our luggage and done the job. Still, the overall experience was disorganised, frustrating, and disappointing.

We left feeling exhausted before our trip had even begun. Based on our experience, I cannot recommend Europcar or Auto Europe and would urge others to think twice before booking.

I would never have hired a car through Europcars had I read the bad reviews and unfortunately have to echo previous reviewers experiences. Didn’t chose them specifically but Ryanair must hold a contract with them as it automatically booked the car with them. Picked up lovely shiny car from Knock airport - did a cursory look around the car - MAKE SURE YOU VIDEO EVERY PART INSIDE AND OUT OF CAR which we didn’t and surprise surprise on returning the car the staff rushed out with a little measuring device and said we had scratched the car on the bumper and it was going to cost almost 1000 euros to fix!!! Firstly the car was driven very carefully, parked in wide disabled places and kept in locked area and never left unattended. I believe the scratches were probably there before. Not checked and they must have thought we will charge us for them. 1000 euros for scratches that could even be rubbed out!!! They even invoiced us within the hour. Even though I have separate insurance I am challenging this as a matter of principle. DO NOT HIRE A CAR A CAR FROM THIS COMPANY

Terrible business. Customer care is non existent. I have spent over 3 hours trying to speak to the Birmingham Newton branch. No one has answered. I have even attempted to call at 8am in the morning (when the business opens up), still no one answers the phone line. I have spoken to their customer service department multiple times, and they haven't been able to hlpe me. As a consumer, it appears that the branch simply doesn't have a phone line, or they're ignoring their phones ringing. I have dealt with countless numbers of businesses a cross all sectors as a consumer, I have never found any business this terrible. Europcar pride themselves on empowering mobility and helping their customers, it looks like they are doing everything besides sticking to their business culture. For anyone reading this review, just go to Enterprise Mobility (another car rental company). I'm not sure how this business is still in operation looking at their trash customer service.

AVOID!!
Have taken money out of my bank for damages to tyres i did not do, disputed by email to be told to send more evidence over in 7days otherwise payment would be taken and they took it out in three! I will be disputing with my bank and letting this go to court absolute scammers just look at all the bad reviews!

My daughter and son hired me a car from this company through Expedia. They paid extra for Expedia premium insurance. Expidia stated i need pay a £250 deposit. When I turned up at Gatwick airport from Latvia the representive said I had to pay £500 deposit which i never had. After a stressful wait my family transferred the extra money to my account. Europcar representive asked me to sign rental agreement which I did and they issued me a car. The car was returned 10 days later and I flew home. My £500 deposit was returned the following day. Then i had 2 payments taken from my account for £380, I found out that the representive had added premium insurance without my knowledge and after many emails to there customer service department they refused to refund the charge. I am a pensioner on a small income this has created me with financial problems. BE CAREFUL OF THIS COMPANY WATCH WHAT YOUR SIGNING FOR.

When I wanted to extend the hire period, I called them and was told the van had actually been returned the day before, which is not true. I started calling them around 10:30 and kept trying until the afternoon, but still no answer. I was even on hold for hours, and no one was able to help. They kept pushing me from one person to another. It’s now 15:10 in the afternoon, and I still haven’t gotten an answer.

I wonder if the van shows as returned because I have the return statement and the invoice, for which I paid in full. However, the driver was charged for insurance again at the branch on the collection day.

What if I keep the van since no one has been able to fix this inconvenience? I would not recommend this service at all. Their communication skills are poor, and when I finally managed to get someone on the line, she hung up on me just because I was asked for stupid details that were not relevant at all, considering the van hire period was completely closed.
I am talking about the Stevenage branch and Peterborough branch.

Hired a car large famiky to be delivered
Paid, pre check driving licence. All done easy!?
Called from Europcar to say can't deliver and only have a Fiat 500.
Agent apologised and canceled the booking advising no payment would be taken. 3 days later payment taken and customer service agent contacted was awful. Did not care and said will have refund in 10 working days. Refused to take complaint or escalate call. Never again

Complete joke, we dropped off the car at Lanzarote airport no one there to check the car over. got home to discover a claim from europcar for a scratch that we hadn't caused for £350. The car was damaged, dented and scratched from previous hiring that we highlighted to them when we picked it up. I'm sure all this damage had been previously claimed and paid but never repaired. Just complete scammers and insurance fraudsters!! Wilkl never use again!! Beware you will receive a claim! Probably even using old photos as claim and damage proof!!

Awful experience. I was in the UK to move my mum into care following her strokes and I hired a car from Eurocar. I returned it, with no damage to the car, gas tank full, and got a return receipt as proof of that. I had already paid for the hire and full insurance prior to arrival, so when I queried the additional large charge to my credit card when I arrived back home 2 week later, I discovered they had in fact charged me twice for the one car hire. It has been extremely stressful given why I was in the UK in the first place, but then to have this extra charge on my card, it has caused me no-end of stress. I made a complaint, raised a claim and have heard NOTHING from them. They owe me almost £400 and I have not had any response from their claims team. PLEASE DON'T USE THEM. Unfortunately I am now involving a solicitor which they will end up paying for. Such a simple solution could have been given, with all my paperwork and proof of overcharges, they just needed to refund me. I hate giving bad reviews, but this time it is 100% warranted.

Shameful Conduct at Stansted – Predatory, Dishonest & Utterly Disgraceful

Avoid Europcar at Stansted at all costs. My wife was traveling urgently to visit a critically ill family member and was emotionally vulnerable. Europcar staff seized the opportunity to pressure her into a vehicle upgrade she never asked for, slipping in a £142+ charge that she was never made aware of — all disguised beneath a rushed signature.

Let me be clear: this was not a misunderstanding. This was exploitation. A predatory upsell tactic targeting someone in distress. And when we raised the issue, Europcar HQ responded with a robotic, tone-deaf statement dismissing it entirely — citing a "signed document" as though it excused the behavior.

Worse still, the Cardiff Europcar branch reviewed the situation and told us clearly: 'this would never happen under our watch.' So yes — the Stansted team is acting on its own agenda and damaging the Europcar brand in the process.

This was manipulative, unethical, and cowardly. If this is how Europcar treats long-time customers and Privilege Members, they deserve every bit of reputational damage this review brings.

We are escalating this to senior management, Trading Standards, the Competition and Markets Authority, and the ECRCS.

You’ve lost our business permanently.

Justin Wride
Europcar Privilege Member

Utterly deceitful scammers.
They convinced my wife to upgrade, claimed it was a discount, but charged us 250 pounds a day, when the same car was listed on their website for less than 200 when I checked later in the day. The desk at Heathrow, led by Shane the manager, are nothing more than con artists who forcefully upsell and trick people into massively overpaying, and the customer service is useless when trying to recover some of the fees. Never, ever rent with Europcar. I had previously had decent experiences but will never deal with them again.

Edit: Europcar have replied asking me to contact their customer service, but I already did and they refused to do anything about it

Give us the chance to solve the issue by providing more details using this link https://www.europcar.co.uk/contact-us/email where our customer service team will be in touch.

We hope to see you again.

The Europcar Team

Rented a van, with only 650 miles on the clock, I drove it 30 miles and it averaged 38mpg. When I refilled the tank with diesel I was expecting to only put a gallon of fuel in. But, to my surprise I had to put 3 gallons in to replace (top up) what I had used as I was informed that the van had a full tank of fuel when I picked it up.

So, obviously the fuel tank wasn’t full when I picked the van up but I was told the tank was full and it should be returned with a full tank. I spoke with the branch manager at Chelmsford where I rented the van from and requested a refund for the 2 additional gallons of fuel that I had put in their van.

The million dollar question is… are they carrying out sharp practice to fleece their customers or is it some skullduggery from an employee, either way it’s not right.

Be warned make a note of the mileage and the average mpg used whilst in your rental.

I have twice been on their website to complain, filled in all the questions, written a lengthy complaint and when I pushed the upload button it defaults to “there is an issue with our webpage” handy so I am left writing this review to vent my frustration…

I have tried to contact customer services again as requested in their reply below and it still says there is a technical issue and it sends you back to the start again. It’s now 4 times that I have tried this method….Like the company it isn’t working properly 😡

We hired a car through Europcar in France via a third party. All went well until we returned the car. The receiving agent spotted a scratch in the bonnet, that I hadn't seen at pick up, and had to squint in certain lights to see when she pointed it out. It could easily have been there when we picked up the car and I wouldn't have seen it. We rubbed the 'scratch' with a bit of water and a thumb and it appeared to be lifting, so I thought nothing more of it as I was convinced a polish would buff it out.

When I returned back to England I got a bill for £320 to repair the 'damage'. I tried to challenge them, but got stock corporate responses demonstrating how little they cared.

They are cheap, but avoid as you will be ripped off if there is any hint of damage. I will never use them again.

Despite getting the stock response from Europcar below and emailing them with details of my complaint, a month later and I'm still waiting for a response. Their treatment of customers is truly awful.

Appalling company, avoid at all costs. I received an email yesterday saying that my hire car would be dropped off at 6pm, nothing arrived. Nobody picks up when you try to call the Chelmsford office and nobody replies to emails.
I have just wasted most of the day on the phone being told lots of different things, still no car and there is nobody around at the Chelmsford office to answer calls, you just get put through to a call centre, where nobody is able to tell you what is happening. I have lost a days work and still unable to find out if and when my car is being dropped off….

Cannot stress enough, avoid, avoid, avoid. We used Europcar for a courtesy car recently and have had the worst experience - the customer service line is abysmal, when they can't answer your query they put the phone down or pass you back to the main menu. Our local branch won't answer the phone at all (to us or our insurance company) and we're having to chase repeatedly to get their car picked up from us. After being told there's no complaints department, we're close to giving up. There are plenty of other car rental companies, please avoid this one.

Have been incorrectly charged by Edinburgh airport branch for over 500 miles worth of fuel evidently used by subsequent hirer despite my having returned the vehicle on time, in person with a staff member who signed it off assuring me he was satisfied no charges had been incurred. Double checked all was well since he seemed casual and initially barely looked at the car until I urged him to check it thoroughly. He also appeared to get the wrong paperwork from the office but confirmed he had corrected this which I now realise was not true. My complaints and evidence attesting to having returned a fully refuelled vehicle have been ignored.

I rented a van from Europcar, and the experience was nothing short of disgraceful. The attendant at the reception was not just rude — she was downright hostile. She repeatedly pressured me to accept unnecessary add-ons and even went so far as to suggest I’d likely end up in an accident for declining the additional insurance excess reduction. That kind of fearmongering is completely unacceptable. She asked the same intrusive questions multiple times — “How far are you going?” “When exactly are you bringing it back?” — in a tone that made me feel like I was begging to borrow her personal vehicle rather than paying to rent from a major company. The whole exchange was uncomfortable, condescending, and frankly, humiliating. At one point, I was so taken aback by her attitude, I genuinely considered walking away and telling her to keep the van. Renting a vehicle shouldn’t feel like being interrogated or talked down to. If this is how Europcar treats paying, polite customers — then count me out for good. I wouldn’t recommend this branch to anyone. Absolutely dreadful service.

This was the worst car rental experience I’ve ever had.

From the beginning, we were treated with arrogance and disrespect. I had booked a decent car, and they handed me a wreck – filthy, falling apart, and barely drivable. It looked like it belonged in a junkyard. An absolute disgrace.

I had purchased full insurance coverage, so I wasn’t supposed to be charged for anything. Still, they held a deposit of £125, which was initially released, and then they took the money from my account after I had already left, with no explanation. That’s not a mistake – that’s outright theft.

This is not just poor service – it’s dishonest and unethical. Europcar in Tunis is running a scam. What they’re doing is not car rental, it’s abuse and legalized robbery.

Avoid this company at all costs. I wouldn’t wish this experience on anyone.

Hello Mohamed,

We appreciate your feedback and we are sorry to learn you were dissatisfied with our service.

Give us the chance to solve the issue by providing more details using this link https://www.europcar.co.uk/contact-us/email where our customer service team will be in touch.

We hope to see you again.

The Europcar Team

The rental agreement on checkout at Newcastle had an existing damage described. When I checked the car in at Gatwick, the man gave me a form to sign on an iPad that had no description of any damage. He later (after I had signed and left) inserted pictures of the existing damage into the signed document under “new” damage. Completely unethical and illegal. Europcar are now claiming the original rental agreement was not signed and counter signed so the existing damage is not counted as existing but new! This company cannot be trusted. Avoid! To top it off, the original cost was £147 but I ended up paying £304. I’m astounded by the lack of customer service when trying to resolve this matter.

Hello Brian,

One of the worst experience!
It's a scam don't trust europcar I went for 4 days in Tunisia I activated the insurance to have peace of mind and guess what they first gave me the money back in the airport but when I came back in UK the day after they charged me again !!!!!!
Bad customer service in Tunisia and bad customer service here too!Disgusting !

Hello Michele,

We hope to see you again.

The Europcar Team

Professional scammers. Stay away. One of the worst experiences we had with a car rental company. We ended up paying €1000 for a basic 208 Peugeot which on their website was €300 when we initially paid for it. They also scammed us with €200 for a 3cm scuff on the wheel which was there before we rented the car, I showed the picture to them and the representative said I shouldn’t worry because it’s covered by the insurance (this was of course a lie) but they just need to record it for the next rental. They then also billed €87 for the damage admin fee. Be prepared to never see your deposit back and once you return the car if you don’t have a credit card then make sure you move the money from your account as they will just start charging random amounts to your debit card. Make sure you email all photos and videos and detailed description 1hr after you get the car as otherwise they won’t care what photos or videos you have. They lie, scam and steal and add secret charges that you didn’t ask for. We didn’t ask for roadside assistance and somehow it showed up on the invoice. There’s also a massive airport fee which they don’t tell you about in advance. Every price they say is without VAT, which they forget to mentioned. Do yourself a favour and find a local/family owned company outside of the airport and never go near Europcar as you will be robbed. Hopefully someone will eventually win a legal case against them.

I enquired on their website to ask if they would hire me a Peugeot 3008 for 35 days before I complete the booking by transferring to the payment section and received a vague response from Gabriela of their reservation team - saying that 'due to the dynamic nature of our pricing system we are unable to guarantee prices over email'
Having been bitten before now by finding out at the last minute that they hire for a max. of 30 days I wanted an answer before spending £3,400.
None given so you have lost my custom forever. BB

Bait and Switch, it's their standard practice from my experience. Just this morning I spoke to a friend who had exactly the same experience with these shonky pricks.
They present you with two sets of keys (presumably because they don't have the car you have already booked and paid for), then, when you ask what the price difference is, they say "50 pounds", or "30 pounds" in my friends case.
They conveniently forget to mention PER DAY.
My friend was clever enough to catch them before he signed. I was not, and it tripled the cost of the rental. They have no interest in reversing the transaction with ended up costing my wife and I (who were both at the desk, and both heard the Europcar staffer NOT mention that it was a daily charge), 1250 pounds extra!
Read the other reviews. You will find that it is their standard tactic. They are amoral and unprofessional.
Complete shysters.
STAY AWAY!

BUYER BEWARE if you are thinking about renting a car from Europcar.
After reserving and paying for a car rental through a third party before leaving the United States, on arrival in Southampton I presented the 3rd party rental voucher to the Europcar agent who accepted it without comment. He told me, however, that the car I reserved was not available and I was offered an upgrade for £9 a day extra for the 14-day rental period. I accepted this and the agent made out a rental agreement reflecting the upcharge. At no time did the agent in Southampton tell me that the payment we made through the 3rd party would be disregarded and that Europcar would be re-billing the entire rental amount again. However, 4 days after returning the car, Europcar charged my credit card the full rental price plus the upgrade charge. In other words, I ended up paying for the car twice.
After calling the company’s customer service three times and explaining the situation by email, my complaint fell on deaf ears. I was finally told that the voucher I presented in Southampton and that the agent accepted and kept without comment had not been applied.
To add insult to injury, upon returning the car at the exact time and date stated on the rental agreement (as confirmed by the agent who received the car), I was charged for an extra day after being told the car should have been returned an hour earlier.
Apart from being conned out of more than $500, the worst part of this experience has been trying to communicate with a company that is completely deaf to their customers concerns. The customer service rep., who is located somewhere overseas, will let you talk about your problem endlessly and then do nothing about it. Ask to speak to a supervisor: ‘sorry there are none’. I have to assume that using bait and switch tactics to justify ignoring payments from third parties is a common Europcar practice in order to avoid paying fees to those parties.
Since we still needed an additional rental in the UK, we discovered Drivalia, which came highly recommended. It is understandable because their rates are half of what Europcar charges and their customer service reps are extremely friendly and accommodating.
Hopefully, my own experience with Europcar’s unethical business practices will serve as a caution to anyone in future looking to do business with an ethical car rental company.

Review update: In response to Europcar's standard corporate response.
We had already contacted Europcar 4 times by phone and email, detailing the complaint. They have either not bothered responding at all or on one occasion were completely dismissive.
The attempt by Europcar to act like they care now is nothing more than a laughable PR stunt.

I was charged for damage, some minute scratches, which I’m told I should have taken pictures of, despite picking the car up in the dark and only having it for 12 hours where it was almost all dark, driving around 50 miles on main A roads, clearly this wasn’t me however Europcar have charged £500 (!!!!) . Do not use this company, clearly this is an income stream.

So far I have been in the queue at Zurich airport to pick up my pre booked car longer then it took me to fly here from Manchester!! Ridiculous. No staff. People with no reservation spending 30+ minutes at the desk standing in the same queue as me. I will never use this company again. I would suggest you don’t either. Hertz on the other hand has no queue.

After an accident my AA Insurance organised a loan vehicle, the vehicle was dropped off at my home address keys left with a relative.
On my return I inspected the vehicle and proceeded to do a short run to the local store but found the tyre warning light on, I thought maybe the tyre needed pumping up , after a 8 minute journey the tyre went completely flat resulting in calling out the AA and being escorted to quick fit for a new tyre, the AA engineer found a tyre valve wedged in the wall of the tyre.
Eurocar want me to pay £159 for a new tyre which is an absolute disgrace.
They should have let me inspect the vehicle before leaving the keys with someone els , as now I can’t prove the vehicle was ok at time of drop off.
SO I SAY DONT EXCEPT A VEHICLE WITH EUROCAR UNLESS YOU INSPECT IT INSIDE AND OUT .

As we've said many times yes we signed a contract but we were told an untrue story about our luggage which was not corroborated by their other 2 depots namely our luggage was too big. The other depots both said we should not have been charged more for the car and they hadn't heard of any luggage laws as told to us.
1. We asked the guy in Edinburgh to try our luggage in the car we hired but he refused. He told us there were restrictions on putting luggage on the rear seat (a small carry on bag) He also told us the police were on the lookout for hire cars doing this on the North Coast 500, not knowing the laws we believed him. But I haven't seen any corroboration on the internet to say this is true.
2. We went to Inverness to swap our car as instructed by Europcar's head office via email.
3. Inverness advised us he had not heard from head office and advised us to keep going as smaller cars are like hens teeth. What did they expect us to do? We had already paid $1900aus and had pre booked accommodation.
4. We only signed because we had to have something because we were booked ahead.
5. At no time after we went to Inverness depot were we instructed to go back for a smaller car which we would have done. So why were we instructed to go to Inverness only to find no car available, and why weren't we told to come back the next day or at some other time...were we expected to walk around Scotland??
All of the above borders on a shonky deal and we have been trying to resolve this since April 24th....how long does it take.
The contract was signed after we assumed the story we were told was true but since found out it was dubious at best so....if you sign a contract under wrong assumptions it should be voided. Was the initial amount we paid not considered?
The car had lollies and other packets in the glove box...the guy in Edinburgh said we might have to fill up with Adblue which we had to do on the first fill of the tank....this should be done by Europcar not the customer...there was no manual in the car so we could not learn anything about how the controls worked. We would never recommend Europcar to anyone, quite the opposite especially when we have been fobbed off with the phrase "but you signed the contract" so even though we were told a story to get us into a bigger car which we didn't want and didn't order it doesn't matter to Europcar?
We booked a Citroen C3 or similar and we would have easily fit our luggage in that sized car. When we took the car back to Manchester Trafford Park the man who took delivery of the car was called Usama and he told us we should not have to put Adblue in the car as it's Europcar's job to do it...he said the guy in Edinburgh might have lied to get a bigger bonus...he said we would be reimbursed for the Adblue and the bond money both of which we are yet to see.
Thanks,
Peter Brock

We booked a car via sunny cars for eur 350. When we came back home I received an extra amount to pay of eur 500 for upgrade car, surcharge airport and insurance. This is what happenend.

We were in a hurry , because we had a delay with the airplane and had a meeting. The woman who helped us , Sharon, was very nice and said to help us as quickly as possible and that everything was taken care of. She said that she would provide us with a nice car. She saw that we already had full coverage via Sunny cars so also no need to check the car.
“ We have to block a certain amount on your credit card but that is for deposit purposes only” she said “ You just have to sign here , here and here and then you can go “

So that is what happened . When we were back in the Netherlands I received your mail about the credit card payment. AN EXTRA eur 500 ( apart from the gasoline which is OK )

This is part of their business model . BE CAREFULL with EUROPCAR UK

I got a hire car through the RAC until my car goes into repair with Arnold Clarke next week. Thought great it’s coming within a few hours but once the car arrived I wasn’t happy at all. I was told the car was with the valeting team before it gets delivered which was a lie. The car is filthy to the point the cloth I used was black after wiping down all the interior. The carpets are full of crumbs, dirt and stains which look like blobs of sick 🥴 It also smells horrible it’s a 74 plate MG which is the same year as my car with just over 10,000 miles for a car to smell the way this does you’d think it was 12 years old and never cleaned. For someone that’s on a mobility scheme for my child & have my child in this filthy was just not a option I will be cleaning it for my use only but I will not be returning it immaculate as this is not the condition it was delivered in very disappointed and haven taken pictures as proof.

Scamming extras out of nowhere.

We booked a small car to go away for the long weekend in the beginning of May and everything went well, they even gave us an upgrade which was amazing. Quick to pick up the car, great to bring it back, everything speedy...

However.... not being a local and not having driven loads in the UK roads, it can be extremely hard to avoid getting an automatic fine. I went into a bus lane on a Monday (bank holiday though) on an empty road, at a junction that is designed so you will unavoidably touch the bus lane if you are not laser focused on the markings on the road. A very scammy, tricky place to get a fine.

I get the fine on my email. £35. Angry but i said ok, better luck next time. Then i see that Europcar thinks its ok to add a £45 'administration' fee, as if they have to do anything time consuming, other than send an email.

So they want MORE than the fine because what you can do? Its in the booklong terms and conditions.

Fear not, i will pay you this administration fee but you WILL NEVER SEE ME AGAIN as a customer.

I took great care to be careful with the car and return it in great shape, i was on time and i get 'fined' with nothing, so you can pocket easy money? That's the last you will ever see from me again. Bye!

Hired a car to be delivered to my home address on 14/05/25 to be returned on 21/05/25. Reservation confirmed and payment of £203.54 was taken from my bank account immediately (14/05/25). Booked a car through an agency for 350 EUR for six days, were offered an upgrade for 30 GBP per day and were charged 625 GBP extra in the end. Contacted UK Customer Service, who did nothing about it. Unethical company that robs clients. A shameful way of making money. Disgusting.

And don’t think Europcar tries to resolve this issue by adding the reply below. If Europcar wanted to resolve anything, they had every chance. So no. They will never see us again.

Would have given 0 stars if option

Seems to be a theme about mis selling insurance. I am currently "in conversation" with customer services about added extras I never ordered and I am looking for a refund. I never requested roadside assistance or personal protection but these were added to invoice. This is a scam where they make these additions part of your deposit. It is basically theft.

Customer services have now told me that cannot do anything as they were not part of verbal conservation at location - they have said that I should have been offered extras and asked to accept or decline which never happened.

So basically buyer should be aware of this practice and scrutinise what you are signing up for and make sure no extras have been added surreptitiously

I would also beware of premium location surcharge that is added to costs.
I certainly will not hire from them again.

AVOID. Terrible hire company.

Paid to hire a van online, money came out of my bank. Rang the HQ the day before to confirm everything is good to go for the hire day, they confirmed that the van will be ready and everything has gone through fine. When I turned up to pick up the van I PAID to hire, I got told they do an “eligibility” check to see if you can afford to pay the fees. I got declined, even though I already paid for the hire. There’s no credit?? What hire company does credit checks for something not on credit? Afford rent a car, enterprise are MILES better than these cowards. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Especially the Stoke On Trent branch.

I recently had a car delivered by Europcar mobility section while my mobility car was being repaired after I was rear ended, the car was left outside my property unlocked and they left the key and paperwork with my son, when I went out to the car the next day I found it had a couple of dents that weren’t on the paperwork.
When they picked up the car I made sure it had a full tank of fuel, but then they tried taking £49.60 out of my bank account, I complained and sent proof of the amount of fuel it had in, they then admitted it was full but are now trying to make me pay for delivery and return mileage fuel ! This company are Scam artists!!!

Edit 26 May: It is impossible to get hold of anyone on the phone or via email. It all looks professional but there is ZERO customer service. Do not go near this company.

For a 6 day hire my bill so far is gbp 400 plus deposit. I feel totally ripped off. I have not been able to drive the car because a tyre had 2 holes in it and no one was interested in resolving the problem. I have been stuck in one place waiting for repairs to be done. There was no spare tyre.
I went through Rentalcar.com which is a broker. I was in a difficult situation and had to hire in a hurry for a next day, Saturday, start. I requested a Leeds city pick up and Manchester airport drop off on Thursday. I was charged 233gbp, then 85gbp extra when I went to pick up the car because the ‘different drop off location’ had ‘dropped off’. Plus a deposit which was ok and expected, if large. There was another extra charge for road usage when I picked up the vehicle. Prices are advertised in GBP but my UK credit card was charged in NZ dollars - I’m using an NZ mobile phone and drivers license but there was no obvious option to change the currency quoted/charged in. So then the insurance cover was added - the wording strongly suggests you need their full insurance offer. This was £65 for 6 days. Charging my UK credit card in NZ$ incurred four times unnecessary conversion fees. By now I’m committed and don’t have time (or energy because I’m dealing with a family emergency and really need a good reliable car, right now) to find another supplier so accepted the deal.
I booked a 10am pick up. There was a 15’ wait before being able to begin completing the paperwork and pick up the car. The car itself is ungroomed in the interior, and didn’t drive well from the get go. Shortly after leaving the pick up point an alarm appeared saying ‘tyre pressure low’. I did not have time to deal with this immediately. When I called Europcar (the end supplier) two days later, by which time the wheel alignment feels obviously wrong, I waited a very long time for an answer and was eventually shunted through to someone who turned out to be the AA who came out to check the car through their breakdown service. Whilst the AA is always great, I could have called them on my own membership and saved the 30 minutes + waiting for Europcar to answer. So at this point I had no usable car (for which I’ve paid a very expensive total hire rate) and was stuck waiting for a roadside rescue service to help me out with ‘my’ problem. The AA turned up as promised an hour later, removed a nail ‘which has been in there a long time’, did a temporary fix so I could get to some local appointments early the next day (having by now not been able to get to that day’s necessary hospital visit and run other urgent medical-related errands), and booked a new tyre service Kwikfit who replaced the tyre the next day. They found another nail in the tyre and let slip that poor quality tyres on loaned-out vehicles are a common problem with Europcar vehicles. The worst part of this is that Europcar do not answer the phone and even when they do couldn’t give a damn. When I did eventually get through to a customer service agent she was smugly rude by just meeting my concerns with deliberate silence. She finally put me through to ‘the local branch’ (an ad loop telling lies about how great Europcar is) which clearly no one answers) where I was on hold over 30’ before I gave up. Worst customer experience ever. Will never use rentalcar.com or Europcar ever again.

I've never left a bad review for the response to a bad review before!
The usual terrible experience that so many of you have described (Europcar rang us 2 hours before we were supposed to pick up the car from Morpeth station saying they don't do pick ups at stations! The 'solution', after much wrangling was a drop off at our hotel, incurring huge drop off fees which they failed to tell us about, but they already had our credit card details, so they just took the money without telling us). The result was we payed over £300 for a 3 day hire, which we had NOT signed up for. I got a generic response to my review (that looked good on the review page) - 'we're so sorry etc, contact customer services on this phone number (didn't work) or this email (bounced back) or via our website (hooked into a loop that there is no response to). So I am admitting defeat and am going to sign it off as a really bad customer experience in which I was cheated by Europcar.
But as there is no option to respond to their 'helpful' response, I am leaving another review here. I'll probably get another 'we're so sorry etc' reply to this, but it goes nowhere, don't be fooled!
I hate leaving bad reviews, but I am still feeling angry about this.

I would give this company 0 stars. First the try to scam you by getting bigger car, then try to scam insurances on you, then if you don’t take additional insurance they contact you months later and try to scam you that there was a damage that never happened and not written on your return report. Scammers from start till the end. DO NOT RECOMMEND!

Respect yourself, your time and your money - stay away from Europcar GLA Office!
Very strong price pressure on car upgrade and purchasing unnecessary services, threatening with fictitious penalties, manipulating documents, adding additional fees etc.

A good tip for your safety - record the conversation with their staff when picking up and dropping off the car, always talk in the presence of witnesses, take lots of photos and do not arrange anything with them verbally, do not allow them to add anything to the contract, keep an eye on the documents at all times, when returning car request an employee's signature stating that the vehicle was returned without damage and refueled!!!

or choose someone less greedy ;-)

Called 2 days ago & got a great quote held for 48 hours, rung yesterday to pay & were told they aren’t open Sundays so we need to bring van back on Monday even though I have an email in black & white saying drop back Sunday. Very disappointed
I was requested under pressure to pay extra £71.40 as “After Hours” fee when we arrived Birmingham airport for car collection.
Due to a flight delay, we arrived at 11:04 PM—just 4 minutes past office hours
We did promptly call their office at 7:30pm (UK time) in Italy before departure once we knew there was flight delay. This staff, who is on duty, confirmed he could wait up to 30 minutes beyond the usual closing time – until 11:30 PM. We expressed our deep appreciation in phone.
Before making the car booking, we contacted your Customer Service team to clarify what would happen in the event of a flight delay, given that your office hours end at 11:00 PM. We were assured that, as long as we provided our flight number, your staff would monitor our arrival and wait for us accordingly. Based on this reassurance, we proceeded with the booking and submitted our flight information
We explained our situation and referenced the prior conversation with that staff. However, he remained adamant. When we requested an official policy document justifying this charge, he became defensive, accused us of being impolite, and refused to provide any documentation. He then stated that unless we paid the fee, he would close the office and WITHOUHOLD the car.
Adding to our discomfort, before demanding the late fee, this staff spent over five minutes trying to upsell us additional insurance. We informed him that we had already purchased full coverage. He replied confidently—but misleadingly—that full coverage did not include wheels and tires, and pressured us to purchase more coverage. When we declined, his attitude changed abruptly, and he immediately brought up the “After Hours” charge.
Lastly, when we arrived at 11:04 PM, the staff member had just finished completing the documentation for the previous customer. He was not simply waiting in the office for serving us.
I fully agree that flight delay was not Europcar’s fault and was not their responsible for this either.
However, they did not keep promise and still charged us after failing to sell us insurance, simply because we were only 4 minutes late.
They not only refused to issue a refund, but also failed to provide any documentation justifying the 'late charge' as per their Terms and Conditions
Please think carefully before ordering a car from them, even if their initial prices seem cheaper.

I had an accident with my car (not my fault) and received a replacement car similar to mine, from Europcar. It took about 40 days to fix my car so during this time I did about 2,000 miles. When finally my car was ready, I was told that I can leave the rental at the repair garage, as this was apparently, the usual practice. It took Europcar 3 days to collect their car and I received the collection report with all the images, which looked okay. I've been driving for more than 40 years, dozens of different rental cars around the world, never had a damage. I did not suspect any problems with the rental car, as usual.
What was my surprise when a month later I got a message from Europcar stating there was damage to the rental car worth nearly a £1,000! There was no visible damage to the car while in my possession and I am not aware of anything like that! The images presented were magnified x20, making minor scuffs and scratches look massive. The car was not at the place where I left it, and was also cleaned. There was no mention in the contract that 2mm scuffs will be considered a damage worth £1,000!
I feel so sorry I accepted their service as they are clearly after ripping off their customers. The car was not even repaired, it was rented again to other people, and the damage claimed is barely noticeable. They took advantage of me as I was so stressed by the accident I had. Europcar made me sign documents I was not in a proper state to thoroughly read, made me agree to a huge excess (£1,000, no coincidence?), they even claimed a damage described in their paperwork upon vehicle delivery.
I would strongly recommend - DO NOT use Europcar! They would only try to rip you off as much as they can! I wish I never had to use their lousy service and will, most definitely, avoid Europcar from now on. Europcar is an absolute disgrace!

The experience with the car itself was fine.

What really let me down was the treatment I received.
I arrived with my quote for the car ready, online check in completed, ready to pick up my vehicle.

Then the employee proceeded to ask me what option I wanted for insurance, giving me only two, and choosing his words deliberately making it sound like what I was choosing was the option that would leave my quote unaltered.

Perhaps there was an element of me being naive but the same thing happened to the person before me, so I tend to think it’s a tactic they use.

When it came to the payment, lo and behold, the price was DOUBLED.
So, when they give you insurance options, make sure to ask what ALL your options are, and make sure to specify that you want the cheapest/no additional insurance. Otherwise they will try to take you for all you’re worth.

That’s without even mentioning the lack of care, they are supposed to come out and show you the car’s features, how to use it, etc.
Mine was an EV which I had never used before, he just gave me the keys and sent me on my way.

Overall extremely negative experience.

Avoid at all costs!

My insurance company gave me a rental car from Europcar for a week in September 2024. Everything went smooth and handed back the car with no issues. After 7 months my insurance company had called me saying that Europcar have put a claim through mentioning there is a chip on the windscreen! They blamed me for it after 7 months which surely doesn’t make sense! You have customers all the time using your vehicle so how can they accuse me for it? They didn’t call me or send me anything and next thing you know I have been charged £619.89 on my credit card out of nowhere without consent. No mention from them for this charge at all. This is fraud!!!! Avoid these scammers! I have called them up and they just mention they have put a dispute in. 1 week later no call back nothing. They have stolen my money!

Booked car rental with Keddy (Europcar).
Once the rental was complete Europcar charged me EUR 354.90 for Premium Protection Package & Premium Station Surcharge.
I was never advised about these extra charges and never agreed to them (they were added to the Rental Contract without my knowledge).

Miss sold upgraded car
We arrived to pick up our car 20 minutes early and were told our car was not ready and that they could not tell us when our car would be ready. But that if we wanted we could take an upgraded car that was ready to go for £20.
Given that I had 2 young children (4 and 1) with me and we’d been on a long flight, I didn’t want to wait an indefinite length of time for the car I’d booked to be ready, so I said I would pay £20 in order to take the car that was ready and leave the airport.

It was only once my card was charged that I double checked the contract and had been charged £20 PER DAY. Had this been clearly explained there is no way I would have paid £200 to leave the airport 20 minutes early. The upgrade was not sold honestly and I have been left feeling tricked by what is meant to be a reputable company.
Would definitely not recommend and be very careful in trusting any information given to you in person

Also, please do not reply saying to raise an issue on the link as you have with the negative reviews of other people, I already submitted a complaint using this process on 28 April and have received no response 10 days later

So unbelievably bad it's shocking. My first experience with them was a year or so ago when I booked a van to move house. They cancelled the night before and ruined everything. Unfortunately I had forgotten this when I booked a car for a weekend away recently. I thought I had paid for everything online (about £200 for 4 days I think) only to be charge over £150 more when I got to the airport (Manchester). I was also told they were offering a "deal" on an upgrade to an automatic - they told me the *upgrade* was an extra £100/day usually but that they'd reduced it to £40 as an offer. Not only am I fairly sure this was a lie (it's not £100/per day more online), the *per day* part was said very quietly. Then they gave me an automatic anyway! A few weeks later I got an admin fee of £45. I believe it easily cost more than double what Avis would have charged (I have used them before and they were honest and transparent and I highly recommend them). This felt like a scam. I'm still angry over a month later.

Never been treated so badly by a hire company
They take the money off you online then cancel your vehicle I had this happen 4 times trying to arrange a suitable collection date over 24hrs they took a total of £1500 out of my account 3 days later I’m still waiting for the refund I actually travelled 25 miles to pick up a van from them that had been confirmed online 2 days earlier only to be sent away empty handed on foot …. Terrible customer service

Con merchants! Avoid
We rented a vehicle from Europ car at Belfast airport, we were in a rush so signed what I was asked to sign as thought it was just a standard rental agreement, had the car for three days , filled the vehicle up before taking it back and everything seemed ok .
Got back home and thought I would check my credit card transactions and noticed they had charged me £480 ! So I read through the paperwork and found they had put all these upgrades and charges on top of my original booking without my consent! So I called up customer services to complain and they also informed me that I had also been charged for fuel top up even though I had filled it up at a fuel station less than half a mile away from I had to drop the vehicle back to … very dishonest company and staff

We had booked a 9-seater Mercedes van on line for a short holiday in Spain. Arrived at Malaga Airport on 5th April. We thought it would be quick service to get our vehicle. Were made to wait an unreasonable amount of time while the staff struggled to locate a Mercedes vehicle. After some delay, the customer service agent remarked, “At last, I’ve found the Mercedes van for you,” and then immediately pushed a rental agreement towards me for signature.
This document listed more than half a dozen scratches, broken parts, and damages — yet none of this was explained or reviewed with me in any way. Most of the text appeared to be in Spanish, with only a few vague English notes.
After waiting for over 30 minutes at the desk, we were handed the keys and told to collect the vehicle from level -2 of the car park. Not only was this an inconvenient distance from the desk, but the underground storage was extremely poorly lit — making it nearly impossible to conduct a proper inspection of the car.

We were told to report any additional damage within 24 hours or risk being held liable for anything not listed. Due to the lighting conditions, we were unable to thoroughly inspect the vehicle. We drove it out and parked at a nearby shopping centre, where we finally had a chance to properly look over it. What we discovered was shocking: the vehicle had over two dozen scratches on the bodywork and extensive internal damage, including loose parts that rattled loudly during the short drive. It was very clear that this vehicle was not roadworthy and should never have been released for rental.
Have already complained (22966365). No explanation has been provided in response to my formal complaint, which I find unacceptable. This response lacks the seriousness the matter deserves and reflects poorly on how Europcar treats its customers.
Don't rent a car through Europcar at Malaga airport. Their cars are parked too far underground, and you cannot inspect the vehicle because of poor lighting. Avis or other cars are parked at a reasonable distance. The message is clear - AVOID Europcar. They only want your money by even putting your life at risk

I had a very disappointing experience with Europcar. I had planned to rent a car for a long weekend, and although they accepted my booking, they failed to provide the specific vehicle I reserved. There were no suitable alternatives offered, and I was left with no real choice but to accept whatever was available. I ended up cancelling my rental which ruined my weekend plan. Not received my money as well. The lack of transparency and poor customer service were extremely frustrating. I do not plan to rent from Europcar again and would not recommend them to others.

I hope and I wish that sooner then latter they will be close down , looking on all those bad reviews somebody needs to take some legal actions . I will go forward with my complain as I felt being financially abused by them in a country when everyone should be treat with respect and dignity .

What a trapdoor this company is. Stay away please take my advice. The errors this company has made against me has cost me thousands of pounds. I am currently trying to retrieve over £1100 that Europcar took out of my account on a saturday morning without any authorisation and having never had a hire car from them. I tried to get a hire the previous month for work for 30 days. I entered everything for them and paid in full before going to collect the car from Manchester airport. When I got there the very aggressive and uninterested staff informed me that they were going to do a credit check on my address. I was not worried as I own my own house lived there for years and don't do credit or debt. The guy comes back and refuses me the car hire. I'm like hang on this can't be right. Also why was this check not done before I'd paid my money. The staff refused to help me I any way and would not allow me to speak to a more senior member of staff. There message to me was go somewhere else you are not getting anything from us today. I was left standing there having giving up the day to collect the car in the first place. I was informed that it would take 20 days to get my money back. Europcar held my money in their account making interest for days before I eventually got it back. No car and no money for 10 days. I launched an investigation to find out why my address had an issue only to find out that the poorly educated and extremely rude member of staff had entered next doors address. I feel he did it on purpose. These guys were a real bad bunch at Manchester Airport Branch. On the 28th April for no reason Europcar took from my account the money again. I have still nor had it back. There is no one to complain to at Europcar there is no real customer service to speak off. These accessed my personal data withdraw money from my account and have held onto it. I have had to register it as a theft with he police I've had to buy a vehicle in order to start my new job at the cost of £8000 taxed and insured lost days in work as a result of it. I don't think I've ever been so badly treated by a company in my life. I actually thought that this type of behaviour by a company was not possible in this day and age but it is. Don't be fooled by this company with the green t-shirt and little euro logo this guys are scam artists and should not be trading at all. I will be bring to the whole thing to trading standards and data protection etc. I never take the time to write reviews but I am writing this to try and save others from being scared like I was. Please stay away from these guys especially at the Manchester Airport branch.

The actual car rental was fine and smooth. After I returned the car , a payment of £10.13 was taken from my account without my knowledge. Tried calling several times and I’ve been going round in circles, last call someone actually answered then I was given a recording for a survey and they hung up. In effect, if they want money from you they will pick up other than that they are not interested.

I wish I'd read the Reviews here before ever using Europcar @ London Stansted Airport & wish I could give a negative score! We had never hired a vehicle before & could almost see ££s signs in the rep's eyes when he asked us. My husband did ask if the car we had booked had a Sat Nav system (Ford Focus or similar booked via Booking.com) & were told that only new electric cars had these. He then went into back office & bought out 2 sets of keys for a Hyundai Kona & a Volvo car - no sign of our original request!! After being bombarded with insurance information & other additional charges told that the insurance already taken out with Booking.com was useless, so told to take out their additional insurance - even charged more for the One-Way charge than anticipated - altogether had to pay an additional £400 for a car we didn't request or need!!! We weren't even shown to the car or shown around the vehicle to check for any damage & it was getting dark by the time we finished with the reams of paperwork. We didn't even know how to start the car initially & had to figure out how to operate the Sat Nav ourselves! The final figure on the Rental Agreement was deducted from my husband's bank account but then adjusted after leaving the Desk. All in all - a totally traumatic experience, which was unexpected & we left shell-shocked. I think the staff are trained to confuse customers into signing up for additional services that they do not want or need. I think that they make customers feel cheap & uneducated if they question the explanation for additional services. I wouldn't recommend this company to my worst enemy. I contacted Booking.com with these details and think they are aware of their practices as they refunded the insurance that I took with them without any questions & advised that the deposit (which we didn't know would be deducted either) would be returned within 28 days but not much else. PLEASE DO NOT HIRE VEHICLES FROM THEM - we will never ever use them.

Thieves, they will steal your money.

I was given a courtesy car, RED MG, in January 2025. They collected it in February 25. On 28/03/25 they charged my card £163.56. I called to ask why they said it was for a Parking fine. I asked for proof which they took their time in sending. The parking fine was for a WHITE VESPA in LONDON. An entirely different vehicle type. Not just that, they don't have common sense. I live 300miles(one way) away from London. The mileage I used in the duration of me having the courtesy car was below 250miles.

Multiple times I have contacted them, but they have usurped the money, refusing to admit that they should have checked before paying the fine or at the very least contacted the Hirer before paying the fine. They keep saying to contact the Parking authority and there is no way to contact them. The Parking Authority's website states fines cannot be appealed once paid. So because of the illiteracy of EuropCar and thieving ethics of them, I am left with a huge £163.60 charge. Already struggling in the current economics and then businesses like these steal from you. I have pictures to provide as well.
I contacted them more than 5 times. I have names to name as well.

Update: I have reported them to the Police.

I accidentally booked with Europcar because somehow they were the first non-ad when I searched for Enterprise Rent-a-Car.
They asked me a lot of details and I jumped through the hoops with app and account etc.
On the day they sent me emails preparing me for my hire and I got to the counter they said they were refusing to hire it to me. No explanation, no extra details taken. Their system said no. I asked why they couldn’t have told me this when I booked it and they said it was their policy not to check eligibility until the customer turned up on the day. I travelled hours to get there and they left me no time to find an alternative. Fair enough if for some undisclosed reason you don’t want to rent it to me but this nonsense policy wasted a lot of my time and left me in a sketchy situation. And this could happen to anyone and you’ll never know till you get there

I was offered an upgrade for £40, discounted from £80. Then told I was signing just to accept the extra £40 as I had already pre-paid the rental in full. Do insist on checking through your paperwork as I later discovered I had been charged £40 per day- £570. Europcar won’t do anything, insisting it is my word against theirs even though I pointed out that logically why would I complain near the start of my rental and why would I triple my costs on a whim? Do not trust the sales agents at Gatwick airport. If you must use this company do not accept any extras at pick- up.

The inspecting agent input the wrong return location - Europcar charged us 79 Euros for returning our car. I sent numerous emails to Europcar customer services UK supplying clear proof of their error. After wasting hours on many detailed emails, Europcar still refused to refund our €79 fee. Europcar 'customer services' clearly exist as a barrier to refuse customer refunds and prevent case resolution. I successfully had a full refund from Mastercard after sending evidence for processing a chargeback against Europcar. I wish I had done it much sooner. So process your credit card chargeback directly after any first refusal in writing ( use email ) from Europcar customer service. Customer services are absolute time wasters. I will never use Europcar again.

AWFUL FROM START TO FINISH.

I hired a van for the day, on a Saturday, to help a family member move house. I paid nearly £80 for the pleasure, along with a £100 deposit and £36 insurance upgrade. The collection process was simple and straight forward, and the bloke who helped me was nice. However, I was told I would need to leave the van in a nearby carpark when I was done with it, as there was no where else to leave it out of hours, but that it would be picked up at 1pm on the Sunday (the following day). Fair enough, although it would have been useful to know this upon booking. I dropped the van off 3 hours before my rental period ended at 7pm on the Saturday, and paid for the parking until the next day (as advised by the staff member) for 12 hours at nearly £8. I received a return statement and invoice on the Monday to say that I was being charged an additional £114.45 as I didn’t hand the car back until the Monday! I contacted customer via phone and email, and sent proof of my drop off, the carpark receipt and all additional info I had to and they essentially fobbed me off and told me it was my fault and that I had indeed dropped the car off on the Monday. They explicitly said I had been charged correctly. They then stopped replying to my emails. I phoned the branch where I hired the van from and they accepted that they had wrongly charged me BUT it took almost 4 weeks to get my money back, and in total I spoke to 6 different people who were useless at helping me. I kept being told ‘it should be with you soon, call back in 2 days’. Overall, a horrific service and unless you push and press them, they are reluctant to accept fault and refund you. I didn’t get one apology during this experience. DO NOT USE THEM.

Our car was damaged on the Friday and the insurance put, us in touch with Europcar for a hire car until the car was repaired the following Monday. We were told they would contact us to take the £1 deposit and get us a car. We heard nothing from them. We made several calls to organise a car but, never got a car or even a call back from them. When we were told our car may not be repaired by then end of Monday, we contacted Europcar again and they told us they would deliver a car to us by 5pm. The car never arrived. Luckily our car was repaired by 2pm. We did not cancel the hire car. It just never turned up and Europcar haven't even bothered to contact us. We called them to make a complaint and they gave a number to call to make a complaint. We called that number and the woman was quite snotty and would not take the complaint.

I booked the car through Easyjet and (in short) this happened at the Europacar desk in Gatwick:

- When picking up the car the person behind the desk tried to upsell. She had 2 keys, one of the MG which would be our car and another key of a car which would have navigation and heated seats. Normally for 100 pound extra, but now only for 40. We declined this and the MG had navigation and heated seats anyway. Seems like very dodgy practice.

- I had to sign a document, I asked what is was for,, the person said I was signing for the car not having any damage. She even joked it felt like “siding your life away”. The car didn’t have any damage but it seems she lied about what I was signing.

- After that I had to swipe my card. I asked if this was for the deposit. She said, yes this is for deposit, this again seems like a blatend lie as my creditcard was charged anyway after returning the car.

Getting a reply from the client service department is a real nightmare. I have send about 6 e-mails (one every week) to get a reply of 2 sentences by someone who clearly didn't care to read buy e-mails or check my case. Renting with Europcar has been an absolute disaster and I wil never do so again.

I have bookked many cars with other rental companies all around the world and I never had any problems. Of course I wouldn't recommend anybody to book with Europcar.

Not low enough I've sent my review to there sister company so if you see it here let's go WARNING do not use eurocar hire company they can't be trusted. 11 days after l returned car they text me of damage to rear passenger door behind driver I've sent photos of door to my insurance company showing no damage avoid this company like the plague

Beware of GLASGOW AIRPORT Europcar branch

One of the worst experiences of my life.
From the moment you enter their office, strong pressure to take a more expensive car, tricky games with additional services, scaring you with penalties etc.
When you repeatedly refuse to pay for something you don't need, the document combinations begin (folding signed documents in half, adding additional documents by hand, manual addition of services).
At the end, we were charged a deposit (which is normal and understood) but when returning the vehicle we were told that this was not a deposit but additional services and they won't pay us back !!!

Now think about, how you want to call it (#@$%), and whether you want to do deal with such people and such a company?!

ok, I knew this is a waste of time, but I called customer service again, and I talked to Leo (Ipad) again. What are the odds?
At least this time he was honest and told me that there's nothing I can do and they reached out to me on trust pilot just so they look that they are trying.
Big surprise there...
Wow, this company is rotten to the core.

On April 10th we flew to Heathrow, and we took a shuttle to Europcar to pick up the car we already paid for online.
The guy at the desk started to push a free upgrade, a Mercedes GLE SUV. I said I don’t want it because it is an expensive car, but he insisted, saying that the car is not new and has scratches.
Eventually we agreed and he said there’s a deposit of 284 GBP that will be refunded when we return the car.
That’s when he realized that my wife’s driver’s license is expired, but because he was eager to scam us he finished the papers making her the main driver which should be not only against their policies but also illegal. Of course she didn’t drive at all, I was doing all the driving.
I signed the papers and then he said that because it is a free upgrade a manager will have to sign.
The manager came and he signed then we left. What I didn’t realize was that the manage added a 4 in front of 284 making it 4284 GBP.
Also, we didn’t realize until later that they didn’t take any deposit from the visa (for the obvious reasons).

When we returned the car, we noticed the amount on the back, and we asked to speak to the manager (a different one).
He was right in front of us, but we had to wait about 20 minutes because he was trying to push an upgrade to a family.
Eventually we talked to him and he said that it is our fault for signing and he pretty much called me stupid.
We tried to lock the Visa, but it was too late.

We returned to Canada and immediately called Europcar customer Service and talked to Agostina.
I explained the situation including the expired license. She gave us a case number and said she will e-mail us with a resolution.
After couple of hours we got and e-mail for her saying that our request was respectfully denied.
I called again and talked to Leo. I explained to him the situation again, stressing the fact that the contract should be void because
it was issued knowing that the main driver’s license is expired. He agreed and said that maybe Agostina overlooked that aspect.
He gave me a new case number and said he will e-mail us within a day.
The next day we got the e-mail, and he respectfully denied the refund saying “even in the case Mrs Bogatan would not have a
Valid driving license she would remain the legal hirer as it is her who signed the agreement and paid”. That is incorrect
because it was me who signed and paid the agreement.

At no point in our conversation Leo or Agostina seemed surprised that someone would spend 4284 GBP on an upgrade
for a rental that costed about 350 GBP which makes it obvious that everybody there is part of a big happy bunch f scammers that is Europcar.
We checked online and there is an overwhelming number of negative reviews, lots of them describing situations similar to ours.
I guess I should consider myself lucky for not damaging the car, because apparently that is Europcar’s main way to overcharge customers.

The question is how can big company like this openly rob so may customers without any actions from the authorities?

Dan Bogatan

Have rented with Europcar for over ten years, with thousands of cars rented. Please do NOT rent from this company unless you want to have a massive damage bill. NEVER AGAIN. I was then given an old beat up dirty black 4x4 which had marks dents and scratches everywhere - inside and out.

The member of staff laughed about the condition of the vehicle , but time pressing I went with the flow

On returning I’ve been charged €700 for a ridiculous scuff on a door - there is no way that it could have been seen prior and the member of staff rubbed the door so much that they inflicted the majority of the damage whilst I stood there.

I have 4 further bookings with Europcar which I will be cancelling this week and wouldn’t ever use again
